engsen: Take your hands off me , you brute !

chi: 歡快的歌；聖歌；（通常指）聖誕頌歌

eng: to provide, and sometimes serve, food

eng: a hole, or an empty space between two surfaces

engsen: a tax/ticket collector

chi: 忠誠；投入；奉獻；承諾，保證，諾言

engsen: her commitment to left-wing politics/the cause of feminism/the company

chi: 忠誠；投入；奉獻；承諾，保證，諾言

engsen: The swear word "bloody" is wrongly thought by some to be a corruption of the words "by our Lady" .

eng: substances that you put on your face or body that are intended to improve your appearance

eng: substances that you put on your face or body that are intended to improve your appearance
chisen: 我們出售各種各樣的化妝品和洗漱用品，價格公道。
engsen: We sell a wide range of cosmetics and toiletries at a very reasonable price .

chi: 來自世界各地的；國際大都會的；世界性的

engsen: New York is a highly cosmopolitan city .

chi: （與不同地方或組織的人或物）作用相同者，相對應者
eng: a person or thing that has the same purpose as another one in a different place or organization

engsen: The prime minister is to meet his European counterparts to discuss the war against drugs .

eng: the reporting of a particular important event or subject

eng: the fact of dealing with or directing attention to something

engsen: These books give very good grammar coverage (= they deal with grammar very well) .

eng: financial protection so that you get money if something bad happens

engsen: They have a national program that provides health/medical coverage for every citizen .

eng: financial protection so that you get money if something bad happens

engsen: There is no coverage for expenses under $5 000 .

chi: 覬覦，垂涎（尤指他人之物）；貪求，渴望

engsen: She always coveted power but never quite achieved it .

chi: 覬覦，垂涎（尤指他人之物）；貪求，渴望
eng: to want to have something very much, especially something that belongs to someone else

chi: 痙攣，抽筋（常出現在大量運動後）

engsen: Several runners needed treatment for cramp (US cramps) and exhaustion .

chi: 痙攣，抽筋（常出現在大量運動後）
eng: a sudden painful tightening in a muscle, often after a lot of exercise, that limits movement

eng: the fact that someone can be believed or trusted

eng: the fact that someone can be believed or trusted

engsen: He complained that we had tried to undermine his credibility within the company .

engsen: These politicians are just a bunch of crooks .

eng: not forming a straight line, or having many bends

engsen: You have to drive slowly on these crooked country roads .

eng: not forming a straight line, or having many bends

engsen: His front teeth are crooked .

eng: dishonest
chisen: 不誠實的員警
engsen: crooked police officers

chi: 至關重要的；關鍵的；決定性的

chi: 至關重要的；關鍵的；決定性的
eng: extremely important or necessary

engsen: Her work has been crucial to the project's success .

chi: 粗糙的；簡陋的；粗製的；未加修飾的

engsen: a crude device/weapon

eng: rude and offensive
chisen: 粗俗的話／評論
engsen: a crude remark/comment

eng: a police car

engsen: Two cops were sitting outside in a cruiser .

eng: to break, or cause something to break, into small pieces
chisen: 她緊張地在指間撚著麵包。
engsen: She nervously crumbled the bread between her fingers .

eng: to break, or cause something to break, into small pieces

engsen: The cliffs on which the houses are built are starting to crumble .

eng: a hard outer covering of something

engsen: pie crust (= the cooked pastry on top)

eng: a hard outer covering of something
chisen: 地殼
engsen: the earth's crust

eng: to prepare land and grow crops on it, or to grow a particular crop

engsen: Most of the land there is too poor to cultivate .

engsen: The villagers cultivate mostly maize and beans .

chi: 培養，培育；養成；陶冶；改進

eng: increasing by one addition after another

engsen: The cumulative effect of using so many chemicals on the land could be disastrous .

eng: traditional
chisen: 在我們村，女孩按習俗隨母姓。
engsen: In my village , it is customary for a girl to take her mother's name .

eng: likely to cause death
chisen: 致命的病毒
engsen: a deadly virus

eng: likely to cause death
chisen: 致命的武器
engsen: a deadly weapon

engsen: They have been deadly enemies ever since Mark stole Greg's girlfriend .

chi: 極其乏味的，非常無聊的

chisen: 那個派對非常乏味。

chi: 正派的；體面的，正經的；像樣的，相當不錯的

chi: 正派的；體面的，正經的；像樣的，相當不錯的
eng: socially acceptable or good
chisen: 我以為他是個正派人物。
engsen: I thought he was a decent person .

chi: 正派的；體面的，正經的；像樣的，相當不錯的
eng: socially acceptable or good

engsen: It was very decent (= kind) of you to help .

chi: 果斷的，乾脆俐落的，明確的；有決斷力的
eng: able to make decisions quickly and confidently, or showing this quality

engsen: You need to be more decisive .

chi: 果斷的，乾脆俐落的，明確的；有決斷力的

eng: to gradually become less, worse, or lower

eng: to gradually become less, worse, or lower

eng: to refuse

engsen: I invited him to the meeting but he declined .

chi: （根據名詞，代詞或形容詞在句子中的作用）變格；（使）發生詞形變化
eng: If a noun, pronoun, or adjective declines, it has different forms to show if it is the subject or object, etc. of a verb or if it is singular or plural, etc. If you decline such a word, you list its various forms.

engsen: In Latin we learned how to decline nouns .

chi: 奉獻，獻出（全部精力、時間等）
eng: to give all of your energy, time, etc.

engsen: He has dedicated his life to scientific research .

chi: 奉獻，獻出（全部精力、時間等）

engsen: The new president said she would dedicate herself to protecting the rights of the sick and the homeless .

eng: If you dedicate a book, play, performance, etc. to someone, you publicly say that it is in that person's honour.
chisen: 作者將此書獻給自己的丈夫。
engsen: The book is dedicated to the author's husband .

chi: 為（尤指宗教建築）舉行奉獻典禮；為…舉行落成儀式
eng: When a building, especially a religious building, is dedicated, there is a ceremony at which it is formally opened for use and its particular purpose is stated.

engsen: The church was dedicated on 1 March 1805 to the local Saint Jude .

engsen: He has always shown great dedication to the cause .

engsen: She thanked the staff for their dedication and enthusiasm .

eng: to consider or judge something in a particular way
chisen: 該地區現在被認為很安全。
engsen: The area has now been deemed safe .

eng: to consider or judge something in a particular way

engsen: We will provide help whenever you deem it appropriate .

engsen: Anyone not paying the registration fee by 31 March will be deemed to have withdrawn from the offer .

eng: a fault or problem in something or someone that spoils that thing or person or causes it, him, or her not to work correctly

engsen: All the company's aircraft have been grounded , after a defect in the engine cooling system was discovered .

eng: a fault or problem in something or someone that spoils that thing or person or causes it, him, or her not to work correctly

engsen: There are so many defects in our education system .

eng: a fault or problem in something or someone that spoils that thing or person or causes it, him, or her not to work correctly

engsen: It's a character defect in her that she can't ever admit she's wrong .

eng: a state of not having, or not having enough, of something that is needed

engsen: Pregnant women often suffer from iron deficiency .

eng: a state of not having, or not having enough, of something that is needed

engsen: Deficiencies in the education system have been much in the news .

engsen: Pornography degrades women .

engsen: These chemicals quickly degrade into harmless compounds .

chi: （常指壞事）有意的，故意的，蓄意的

chi: （常指壞事）有意的，故意的，蓄意的

engsen: We made a deliberate decision to live apart for a while .

eng: to criticize something or someone strongly and publicly

engsen: The government's economic policy has been denounced on all sides .

eng: to accuse someone publicly of being something that is bad or wrong

engsen: His former colleagues have denounced him as a spy .

eng: the number of people or things in a place when compared with the size of the place

engsen: The area has a high/low population density .

eng: the number of people or things in a place when compared with the size of the place
chisen: 人太多，我們根本就動不了。
engsen: We were unable to move because of the density of the crowd .

eng: the relationship between the mass of a substance and its size
chisen: 鉛的密度大。
engsen: Lead has a high density .

eng: the relationship between the mass of a substance and its size
chisen: 鋁的密度小。
engsen: Aluminium is low in density .

eng: to represent or show something in a picture or story
chisen: 她的畫反映了上個世紀普通人的生活。
engsen: Her paintings depict the lives of ordinary people in the last century .

eng: to represent or show something in a picture or story

engsen: In the book , he depicts his father as a tyrant .

engsen: People were shocked by the advertisement which depicted a woman beating her husband .

eng: to take something, especially something necessary or pleasant, away from someone
chisen: 他聲稱本身自由／權利被剝奪。
engsen: He claimed that he had been deprived of his freedom/rights .

eng: to take something, especially something necessary or pleasant, away from someone

engsen: You can't function properly when you're deprived of sleep .

chisen: 我想請你見見我的副手安•葛列格裡。
engsen: I'd like you to meet Ann Gregory , my deputy .

eng: a person who is given the power to do something instead of another person, or the person whose rank is immediately below that of the leader of an organization

engsen: I'm acting as deputy while the boss is away .

eng: a person who is given the power to do something instead of another person, or the person whose rank is immediately below that of the leader of an organization

engsen: the deputy director/editor/sheriff

eng: to get something from something else

engsen: The institute derives all its money from foreign investments .

eng: to get something from something else
chisen: 拉小提琴能給她得到極大樂趣／滿足。
engsen: She derives great pleasure/satisfaction from playing the violin .

eng: to go or come down
chisen: 這條路很陡，一直通到山谷。
engsen: The path descended steeply into the valley .

eng: to go or come down
chisen: 簡走下了樓梯。

eng: If a negative or bad feeling descends, it is felt everywhere in a place or by everyone at the same time.
chisen: 當我們發現自己迷了路的時候，一種絕望的情緒（在我們之間）彌漫開來。
engsen: A feeling of despair descended (on us) as we realized that we were lost .

eng: a person who is related to you and who lives after you, such as your child or grandchild
chisen: 他沒有後代。
engsen: He has no descendants .

eng: a person who is related to you and who lives after you, such as your child or grandchild
chisen: 他們自稱是一位法國公爵的後代。
engsen: They claim to be descendants of a French duke .

eng: a person who is related to you and who lives after you, such as your child or grandchild
chisen: 給子孫後代留下一個清潔的生活環境是我們的職責。
engsen: We owe it to our descendants (= people younger than us who will live after we have died) to leave them a clean world to live in .

chi: 血緣關係，家族關係；祖先；出身
eng: the state or fact of being related to a particular person or group of people who lived in the past
chisen: 她是一個混血／法裔女人。
engsen: She's a woman of mixed/French descent .

chi: 血緣關係，家族關係；祖先；出身
eng: the state or fact of being related to a particular person or group of people who lived in the past
chisen: 他們的先人可以追溯到一位法國公爵。
engsen: They trace their line of descent back to a French duke .

chi: 血緣關係，家族關係；祖先；出身
eng: the state or fact of being related to a particular person or group of people who lived in the past
chisen: 他自稱是穆罕默德的直系後代。
engsen: He claims direct descent from Mohammed .

eng: an occasion when a group of people arrive somewhere, usually suddenly or unexpectedly
chisen: 我們沒想到數千名記者會突然來到鎮上。
engsen: We weren't prepared for the descent of thousands of journalists on the town .

eng: a movement down

engsen: The plane began (to make) its final descent into the airport .

eng: a movement down

engsen: There is a steep descent (= way down , such as a path) to the village below .

eng: a change in someone's behaviour, or in a situation, from good to bad
chisen: 他很快就墮落到犯罪的地步。
engsen: His descent into crime was rapid .

eng: to choose someone officially to do a particular job
chisen: 按照傳統，總統要選定其接班人。
engsen: Traditionally , the president designates his or her successor .

eng: to choose someone officially to do a particular job
chisen: 湯姆森被指定擔任隊長。
engsen: Thompson has been designated (as/to be) team captain .

eng: to choose someone officially to do a particular job
chisen: 她被派來組織是次會議。

eng: intended (for a particular purpose)

engsen: The money was destined for the relief of poverty , but was diverted by corrupt officials .

eng: intended (for a particular purpose)
chisen: 這些汽車是為歐洲市場生產的。
engsen: These cars are destined for the European market .

chi: 前往（某地）的；寄往（某地）的
eng: travelling or being sent to somewhere
chisen: 海關官員截獲了將近一噸要寄往紐約的海洛因。
engsen: Customs officers have seized nearly a ton of heroin destined for New York .

chi: 命中註定的，命運決定的
eng: controlled by fate, and not by humans
chisen: 她的事業註定會非常成功。
engsen: She is destined for an extremely successful career .

chi: 命中註定的，命運決定的
eng: controlled by fate, and not by humans
chisen: 這些計劃註定要失敗。
engsen: These plans are destined to fail .

chi: 命中註定的，命運決定的
eng: controlled by fate, and not by humans
chisen: 你認為我們註定是會見面的嗎？
engsen: Do you think it was destined that we should one day meet ?

eng: to separate or remove something from something else that it is connected to
chisen: 如果不想要大衣上的帽兜，可以拆掉。
engsen: You can detach the hood if you prefer the coat without it .

eng: to separate or remove something from something else that it is connected to

engsen: Detach the lower part of the form from this letter and return it to the above address .

eng: to force someone officially to stay in a place
chisen: 一名嫌疑人已被員警拘留接受進一步審訊。
engsen: A suspect has been detained by the police for questioning .

eng: to force someone officially to stay in a place
chisen: 傷者中有幾個人被留院觀察了一晚。
engsen: Several of the injured were detained overnight in hospital .

eng: to prevent someone from doing something or to make someone less enthusiastic about doing something by making it difficult for that person to do it or by threatening bad results if they do it
chisen: 這些措施旨在阻止敵人的進攻。
engsen: These measures are designed to deter an enemy attack .

eng: to prevent someone from doing something or to make someone less enthusiastic about doing something by making it difficult for that person to do it or by threatening bad results if they do it
chisen: 高昂的價格讓很多年輕人對於買房屋望而卻步。
engsen: High prices are deterring many young people from buying houses .

eng: to become worse

engsen: She was taken into hospital last week when her condition suddenly deteriorated .

eng: to become worse

engsen: The political situation in the region has deteriorated rapidly .

eng: to reduce the rate at which money can be exchanged for foreign money
chisen: 去年墨西哥被迫將比索貶值。
engsen: Last year Mexico was forced to devalue the peso .

eng: to cause someone or something to be considered less valuable or important
chisen: 我不想貶低他的成績，但他似乎沒有真正努力就得到了升遷。
engsen: I don't want to devalue his achievement , but he managed to get a promotion without working very hard .

eng: to recognize and name the exact character of a disease or a problem, by examining it
chisen: 那位專家作出的診斷是癌症。
engsen: The specialist diagnosed cancer .

eng: to recognize and name the exact character of a disease or a problem, by examining it
chisen: 他的病被診斷為某種血液病。
engsen: His condition was diagnosed as some type of blood disorder .

eng: to recognize and name the exact character of a disease or a problem, by examining it
chisen: 她被查出患有糖尿病。
engsen: She was diagnosed with/as having diabetes .

eng: a judgment about what a particular illness or problem is, made after examining it
chisen: 醫生已經作出了初步診斷。
engsen: The doctor has made an initial diagnosis .

eng: a judgment about what a particular illness or problem is, made after examining it
chisen: 這種病的早期診斷很難。
engsen: Diagnosis of the disease is difficult in the early stages .

eng: a simple plan that represents a machine, system, or idea, etc., often drawn to explain how it works
chisen: 老師畫了一張示意圖來說明血液如何進出心臟。
engsen: The teacher drew a diagram showing how the blood flows through the heart .

eng: (the length of) a straight line that reaches from one point on the edge of a round shape or object, through its centre, to a point on the opposite edge
chisen: 直徑是半徑的兩倍。
engsen: The diameter measures twice the radius .

eng: (the length of) a straight line that reaches from one point on the edge of a round shape or object, through its centre, to a point on the opposite edge
chisen: 這個池塘的直徑為六英尺。
engsen: The pond is six feet in diameter .

eng: to give orders, or tell someone exactly what they must do, with total authority
chisen: 聯合國將決定軍隊從該地區撤軍的條件。
engsen: The UN will dictate the terms of troop withdrawal from the region .

eng: to give orders, or tell someone exactly what they must do, with total authority
chisen: 他不同意由政府來決定孩子在學校學習哪些課程。
engsen: He disagrees with the government dictating what children are taught in schools .

eng: to give orders, or tell someone exactly what they must do, with total authority
chisen: 規則規定跑道上只能穿跑鞋。
engsen: The rules dictate that only running shoes must be worn on the track .

eng: to speak something aloud for a person or machine to record what is said, so that it can be written down
chisen: 我透過電話口述了命令。
engsen: I dictated my order over the phone .

eng: to speak something aloud for a person or machine to record what is said, so that it can be written down

engsen: She spent the morning dictating letters to her secretary .

eng: the activity of dictating something for someone else to write down
chisen: 我會請我的助手來作口述記錄。
engsen: I'll ask my assistant to take dictation (= write down what I say) .

eng: to show or find the difference between things that are compared

engsen: We do not differentiate between our employees on the basis of their race , religion , or national origin .

eng: to make someone or something different
chisen: 石板瓦屋頂使這座房子在該地區與眾不同。
engsen: The slate roof differentiates this house from others in the area .

eng: a situation in which a difficult choice has to be made between two different things you could do

engsen: The president is clearly in a dilemma about/over how to tackle the crisis .

eng: a situation in which a difficult choice has to be made between two different things you could do

engsen: She faces the dilemma of disobeying her father or losing the man she loves .

eng: a situation in which a difficult choice has to be made between two different things you could do

engsen: a moral/ethical dilemma

eng: a measurement of something in a particular direction, especially its height, length, or width

engsen: Please specify the dimensions (= the height , length and width) of the room .

eng: a measurement of something in a particular direction, especially its height, length, or width

engsen: a building of vast dimensions (= size)

eng: to reduce or be reduced in size or importance
chisen: 我不想貶低她的成就，但她確實得到了很多幫助。
engsen: I don't want to diminish her achievements , but she did have a lot of help .

eng: to reduce or be reduced in size or importance
chisen: 這些記憶不會隨著時間的流逝而淡漠。
engsen: These memories will not be diminished by time .

eng: to reduce or be reduced in size or importance

engsen: What he did has seriously diminished him in many people's eyes .

eng: the management of relationships between countries
chisen: 外交活動迄今未能結束那場戰事。
engsen: Diplomacy has so far failed to bring an end to the fighting .

eng: a book that gives a list of names, addresses, or other facts

engsen: a business directory

eng: a book that gives a list of names, addresses, or other facts
chisen: 飯店指南
engsen: a directory of hotels

eng: a book that gives a list of names, addresses, or other facts
chisen: 在電話簿裡查查他們的號碼。
engsen: Look up their number in the telephone directory .

eng: an illness, injury, or condition that makes it difficult for someone to do the things that other people do

engsen: a physical/learning disability

eng: an illness, injury, or condition that makes it difficult for someone to do the things that other people do

engsen: She is deaf , but refuses to let her disability prevent her from doing what she wants to do .

eng: an illness, injury, or condition that makes it difficult for someone to do the things that other people do

engsen: Trying to change attitudes to disability is an uphill struggle .

eng: to cause someone to have an illness, injury, or condition that makes it difficult for them to do the things that other people do

engsen: She was disabled in the accident .

chi: 使發生故障，使失靈，使無法正常工作

chisen: 該武器系統能摧毀任何來犯的導彈或使其失靈。
engsen: This weapons system will destroy or disable any incoming missile .

chi: 使發生故障，使失靈，使無法正常工作
eng: to stop something such as (part of) a machine, system, or weapon from working

engsen: Disable the alarm system and then enter the building .

eng: to feel that something or someone is bad, wrong, etc.

engsen: The survey showed that 32 percent of respondents approve , 54 percent disapprove , and the rest are undecided .

eng: to feel that something or someone is bad, wrong, etc.
chisen: 我強烈反對未達法定年齡者飲酒。
engsen: I strongly disapprove of underage drinking .

chi: 極其糟糕的；極為失敗的；災難性的
eng: extremely bad or unsuccessful
chisen: 這樣一場戰爭會給國家帶來災難性的後果。
engsen: Such a war would be disastrous for the country .

chi: 極其糟糕的；極為失敗的；災難性的
eng: extremely bad or unsuccessful
chisen: 這個決定將對外交政策產生極為不利的影響。
engsen: This decision will have a disastrous impact on foreign policy .

chi: 極其糟糕的；極為失敗的；災難性的
eng: extremely bad or unsuccessful
chisen: 他第一次嘗試敗得很慘。
engsen: His first attempt was disastrous .

chi: 允許…離開；（尤指）允許…出院；（根據法庭決議）釋放

engsen: Patients were discharged from the hospital because the beds were needed by other people .

chi: 允許…離開；（尤指）允許…出院；（根據法庭決議）釋放
eng: to allow someone officially to leave somewhere, especially a hospital or a law court
chisen: 在獲釋的犯人中有一半多在兩年內又被再次判刑。
engsen: More than half of all prisoners discharged are reconvicted within two years .

engsen: A peace protester was conditionally discharged for twelve months (= allowed to go free only if they do not commit a crime again for this period of time) .

engsen: Large amounts of dangerous waste are discharged daily by the factory .

chi: 排放，排出（尤指廢液或廢氣）

engsen: The oil that discharged into the sea seriously harmed a lot of birds and animals .

eng: to perform a task, especially an official one
chisen: 城市當局必須依法履行其收容無家可歸者的職責。
engsen: The city must discharge its legal duty to house the homeless .

eng: relating to discipline

engsen: disciplinary measures/action (= punishment)

engsen: The newspaper made damaging disclosures of management incompetence .

eng: careful not to cause embarrassment or attract too much attention, especially by keeping something secret

engsen: They are very good assistants , very discreet - they wouldn't go talking to the press .

eng: treating a person or particular group of people differently, especially in a worse way from the way in which you treat other people, because of their skin colour, sex, sexuality, etc.

engsen: Until 1986 most companies would not even allow women to take the exams , but such blatant discrimination is now disappearing .

engsen: They were sent home in disgrace .

chi: 恥辱，丟臉；不光彩的行為

engsen: He brought disgrace on the whole team by falsifying the results .

chi: 可恥的，丟臉的，不光彩的

chi: 可恥的，丟臉的，不光彩的
eng: very bad

engsen: She thought that their attitude was absolutely disgraceful .

chi: 可恥的，丟臉的，不光彩的
eng: very bad

engsen: It is disgraceful that children can get hold of drugs at school .

eng: to take a machine apart or to come apart into separate pieces

engsen: She dismantled the washing machine to see what the problem was , but couldn't put it back together again .

eng: to take a machine apart or to come apart into separate pieces

engsen: The good thing about the bike is that it dismantles if you want to put it in the back of the car .

engsen: Aid workers were said to have been filled with dismay by the appalling conditions that the refugees were living in .

eng: a feeling of unhappiness and disappointment

engsen: The fans watched in/with dismay as their team lost 42–11 .

eng: a feeling of unhappiness and disappointment

engsen: She discovered , to her dismay , that her exam was a whole month earlier than she'd expected .

eng: to send something, especially goods or a message, somewhere for a particular purpose

engsen: Two loads of cloth were dispatched to the factory on 12 December .

eng: to kill someone

engsen: Our handsome hero manages to dispatch another five villains .

eng: more than you need and therefore not necessary; that can be got rid of

engsen: It seemed the soldiers were regarded as dispensable - their deaths just didn't matter .

eng: to spread across or move away over a large area, or to make something do this
chisen: 雨下來時人群開始四處散開。
engsen: When the rain came down the crowds started to disperse .

eng: to spread across or move away over a large area, or to make something do this
chisen: 員警驅散了聚在一起的人群。
engsen: Police dispersed the crowd that had gathered .

chi: 迫使…離開常居地（或原位）
eng: to force something or someone out of its usual or original position

engsen: The building of a new dam will displace thousands of people who live in this area .

eng: to cause someone to be annoyed or unhappy
chisen: 我不會去做任何惹他生氣的事情。
engsen: I wouldn't want to do anything to displease him .

eng: A disposable product is intended to be thrown away after use.
chisen: 用完即棄相機
engsen: a disposable camera

eng: A disposable product is intended to be thrown away after use.
chisen: 日用型即棄隱形眼鏡
engsen: daily disposable contact lenses

eng: the act of getting rid of something, especially by throwing it away
chisen: 危險物質的處理
engsen: the disposal of hazardous substances

eng: the fact of showing no care or respect for something

engsen: What amazes me is her complete disregard for anyone else's opinion .

eng: (of a solid) to be absorbed by a liquid, especially when mixed, or (of a liquid) to absorb a solid

engsen: Dissolve two spoons of powder in warm water .

engsen: Nitric acid will dissolve most animal tissue .

eng: to end an official organization or a legal arrangement
chisen: 議會已被解散。
engsen: Parliament has been dissolved .

eng: to end an official organization or a legal arrangement

engsen: Their marriage was dissolved in 1968 .

eng: to persuade someone not to do something

engsen: I tried to dissuade her from leaving .

eng: to change something from its usual, original, natural, or intended meaning, condition, or shape

engsen: My original statement has been completely distorted by the media .

chi: 使分心，使轉移注意力，干擾
eng: to make someone stop giving their attention to something
chisen: 不要讓她（在學習上）分心。
engsen: Don't distract her (from her studies) .

chi: 使分心，使轉移注意力，干擾
eng: to make someone stop giving their attention to something
chisen: 他試圖轉移人們對其非法活動的注意。
engsen: He tried to distract attention from his own illegal activities .

eng: the state of being very bored or annoyed
chisen: 聽他講課我打不起精神來。
engsen: His lessons bore me to distraction .

eng: the state of being very bored or annoyed
chisen: 那種討厭的噪音快把我煩死了。
engsen: That dreadful noise is driving me to distraction .

eng: the feeling of not trusting someone or something
chisen: 幾個世紀以來這兩個群體一直處於互不信任的狀態之中。
engsen: The two groups have existed in a state of mutual distrust for centuries .

eng: the feeling of not trusting someone or something
chisen: 她對媒體（非常）不信任。
engsen: She has a (deep) distrust of the media .

eng: something that interrupts someone or makes someone feel worried
chisen: 居民受夠了夜總會造成的干擾。
engsen: Residents are tired of the disturbance caused by the nightclub .

eng: something that interrupts someone or makes someone feel worried
chisen: 接聽電話是工作中最大的干擾。
engsen: Phone calls are the biggest disturbance at work .

chi: 多種多樣的，形形色色的
eng: including many different types of people or things

engsen: Students from countries as diverse as Colombia and Lithuania use Cambridge textbooks .

chi: 多種多樣的，形形色色的
eng: including many different types of people or things
chisen: 紐約是一個在文化／種族方面十分多元化的城市。
engsen: New York is a very culturally/ethnically diverse city .

eng: to start to include more different types or things

engsen: Millions of years ago , changes in the earth's climate caused animal and plant life to diversify .

eng: a different route that is used because a road is closed
chisen: 在節日期間，儘量少實行交通禁行措施。
engsen: Traffic diversions will be kept to a minimum throughout the festival .

chi: 轉移注意力的事物；分心的事物
eng: something that takes your attention away from something else
chisen: 商店竊賊通常結夥作案，一人轉移店員的注意力，另一人則偷盜貨物。
engsen: Shoplifters often work in pairs , with one creating a diversion to distract the staff while the other steals the goods .

eng: the fact of many different types of things or people being included in something; a range of different things or people
chisen: 電視節目能充分反映出這個國家民族和文化的多樣性嗎？
engsen: Does television adequately reflect the ethnic and cultural diversity of the country ?

eng: to cause something or someone to change direction
chisen: 這條主幹道重鋪路面時，車輛行人將被分流到側路通行。
engsen: Traffic will be diverted through the side streets while the main road is resurfaced .

eng: to cause something or someone to change direction
chisen: 由於暴風雨，我們的班機被迫改在紐華克機場降落。
engsen: Our flight had to be diverted to Newark because of the storm .

eng: to take someone's attention away from something
chisen: 戰爭轉移了人們對國家經濟問題的關注。
engsen: The war has diverted attention (away) from the country's economic problems .

chi: （尤指政治或宗教的）信條，教義，學說
eng: a belief or set of beliefs, especially political or religious ones, that are taught and accepted by a particular group
chisen: 總統說他不會反對行之有效的軍事學說。
engsen: The president said he would not go against sound military doctrine .

chi: （電影或電視）紀錄片；紀實性廣播節目
eng: a film or television or radio programme that gives facts and information about a subject
chisen: 這部紀錄片從一個嶄新的角度介紹了達爾文的一生。
engsen: The documentary took a fresh look at the life of Darwin .

chi: （電影或電視）紀錄片；紀實性廣播節目
eng: a film or television or radio programme that gives facts and information about a subject
chisen: 他們放映了一部關於動物之間交流溝通的紀錄片。
engsen: They showed a documentary on animal communication .

eng: to give money or goods to help a person or organization
chisen: 一位女商人匿名向該慈善機構捐贈了100萬美元。
engsen: An anonymous businesswoman donated one million dollars to the charity .

eng: to give money or goods to help a person or organization
chisen: 請您慷慨解囊。
engsen: Please donate generously .

eng: money or goods that are given to help a person or organization, or the act of giving them
chisen: 食品和錢的捐贈
engsen: donations of food and money

eng: money or goods that are given to help a person or organization, or the act of giving them
chisen: 我想以母親的名義捐獻一點。
engsen: I'd like to make a small donation in my mother's name .

eng: a person who gives some of their blood or a part of their body to help someone who is ill
chisen: 捐血者
engsen: a blood donor

engsen: One of the drawbacks of living with someone is having to share a bathroom .

engsen: a dreary little town

engsen: She had spent another dreary day in the office .

eng: rain in very small, light drops

chi: 半信半疑的，可疑的；不確定的；不可信的

eng: If a physical or emotional feeling ebbs, it becomes less strong or disappears.

engsen: He could feel his strength ebbing (away) .

chi: （通常指一個特定區域的）生態；生態學
eng: the relationships between the air, land, water, animals, plants, etc., usually of a particular area, or the scientific study of this

eng: a state of extreme happiness, especially when feeling pleasure

chi: （社會）上層集團；掌權人物；出類拔萃的人，精英

chi: （社會）上層集團；掌權人物；出類拔萃的人，精英

engsen: A powerful and corrupt elite has bled this country dry .

eng: giving a clear, strong message

engsen: The pictures were an eloquent reminder of the power of the volcano .

eng: to go onto a ship

engsen: The stories are enacted using music , dance and mime .

engsen: The Cambridge Encyclopedia of Language

eng: the ability to keep doing something difficult, unpleasant, or painful for a long time

eng: the ability to keep doing something difficult, unpleasant, or painful for a long time

eng: to improve the quality of something by adding something else

engsen: Any more pudding would simply be excessive .

chi: 運用；行使（權威、權力等）；施加（影響等）

eng: an organized journey for a particular purpose

engsen: We're going on a shopping expedition on Saturday .

eng: an organized journey for a particular purpose

engsen: Scott died while he was on an expedition to the Antarctic in 1912 .

eng: a high level of knowledge or skill

eng: If something that lasts for a fixed length of time expires, it comes to an end or stops being in use.

eng: If something that lasts for a fixed length of time expires, it comes to an end or stops being in use.

chi: 清楚明白的；明確的；不含糊的

chi: 清楚明白的；明確的；不含糊的

chi: 主動性；自主決斷行事的能力
eng: the ability to use your judgment to make decisions and do things without needing to be told what to do
chisen: 不能總讓我告訴你該做甚麼，你應該有自己的判斷！
engsen: I shouldn't always have to tell you what to do , use your initiative (= use your own judgment to decide what to do) !

eng: the power or opportunity to win an advantage
chisen: 掌握／採取／失去主動權
engsen: to seize/take/lose the initiative

eng: to use a needle and syringe (= small tube) to put a liquid such as a drug into a person's body
chisen: 菲爾患有糖尿病，每天都要替自己注射胰島素。
engsen: Phil's a diabetic and has to inject himself with insulin every day .

eng: to introduce something new that is necessary or helpful to a situation or process
chisen: 如果要挽救這家公司就必須注入大量資金。
engsen: A large amount of money will have to be injected into the company if it is to survive .

eng: to introduce something new that is necessary or helpful to a situation or process
chisen: 我試圖給會議增添一點幽默氣氛。
engsen: I tried to inject a little humour into the meeting .

eng: the act of putting a liquid, especially a drug, into a person's body using a needle and a syringe (= small tube)
chisen: 有些糖尿病患者必須每日注射胰島素。
engsen: Daily insulin injections are necessary for some diabetics .

eng: the act of putting a liquid, especially a drug, into a person's body using a needle and a syringe (= small tube)
chisen: 這種類固醇有時透過注射注入體內。
engsen: This steroid is sometimes given by injection .

eng: the introduction of something new that is necessary or helpful to a situation or process
chisen: 2000萬英鎊將被投入用於改善醫療服務。
engsen: A cash injection of £20 million will be used to improve the health service .

eng: the introduction of something new that is necessary or helpful to a situation or process
chisen: 增添幽默／刺激
engsen: an injection of humour/excitement

eng: (an example of) a situation in which there is no fairness and justice
chisen: 看到人們身陷苦難，她深感世道不公。
engsen: The sight of people suffering arouses a deep sense of injustice in her .

eng: (an example of) a situation in which there is no fairness and justice
chisen: 他們知道這種體制的不公正之處。
engsen: They were aware of the injustices of the system .

chi: 新觀念；新方法；（新觀念或方法的）創造，使用
eng: (the use of) a new idea or method
chisen: 電腦科技最新的發展
engsen: the latest innovations in computer technology

eng: using new methods or ideas
chisen: 她是個具有想像力和創新精神的經理。
engsen: She was an imaginative and innovative manager .

eng: (the process of asking) a question
chisen: 我一直在打聽環遊世界的票價。
engsen: I've been making inquiries about/into the cost of a round-the-world ticket .

eng: (the process of asking) a question
chisen: 打聽這件事沒有用——沒有人會告訴你。
engsen: Inquiry into the matter is pointless - no one will tell you anything .

eng: an official process to discover the facts about something bad that has happened
chisen: 司法調查
engsen: a judicial inquiry

eng: an official process to discover the facts about something bad that has happened
chisen: 公眾要求全面調查政府對這場傳染病的處理是否得當。
engsen: Citizens have demanded a full inquiry into the government's handling of the epidemic .

eng: (the ability to have) a clear, deep, and sometimes sudden understanding of a complicated problem or situation
chisen: 這是一本有趣的書，充滿了對人際關係獨到的見解。
engsen: It was an interesting book , full of fascinating insights into human relationships .

chi: 堅決要求；堅持主張；堅持
eng: an occasion when you demand something and refuse to accept opposition, or when you say firmly that something is true
chisen: 工會堅決要求改善工作條件使員工缺勤的現象有所減少。
engsen: Insistence on better working conditions by the union has resulted in fewer employee absences .

chi: 堅決要求；堅持主張；堅持
eng: an occasion when you demand something and refuse to accept opposition, or when you say firmly that something is true
chisen: 基於阿梅莉亞父親的堅決要求，她被轉到了一個新的班級。
engsen: At her father's insistence , Amelia's been moved into a new class .

chi: 堅決要求；堅持主張；堅持
eng: an occasion when you demand something and refuse to accept opposition, or when you say firmly that something is true
chisen: 她堅持要最好的房間，這使大家都很惱火。
engsen: Her insistence that she should have the best room annoyed everyone .

eng: an occasion when equipment, furniture, or a computer program is put into position or made ready to use
chisen: 你需要額外付安裝費嗎？
engsen: Do you have to pay extra for installation ?

eng: an occasion when equipment, furniture, or a computer program is put into position or made ready to use
chisen: 你會收到一條訊息確認程式已正確地安裝好了。
engsen: You will receive a message confirming correct installation of the program .

eng: a place where there are buildings and equipment that have a particular, especially military, purpose
chisen: 核設施
engsen: a nuclear installation

eng: a place where there are buildings and equipment that have a particular, especially military, purpose
chisen: 軍方在島上仍有幾處軍事基地及設施。
engsen: The military still have several bases and installations on the island .

eng: an occasion when someone is put in an important job or position
chisen: 新任大主教的就職儀式將於一月舉行。
engsen: The installation of the new archbishop will take place in January .

eng: a large and important organization, such as a university or bank
chisen: 醫療／教育／金融機構
engsen: a medical/educational/financial institution

eng: a large and important organization, such as a university or bank
chisen: 哈佛是國際上備受尊崇的大學。
engsen: Harvard University is an internationally respected institution .

eng: a custom or tradition that has existed for a long time and is accepted as an important part of a particular society
chisen: 神聖的婚姻制度
engsen: the venerable institution of marriage

eng: a custom or tradition that has existed for a long time and is accepted as an important part of a particular society
chisen: 戴利夫人是老資歷了——她在公司工作了40年，絕對了解每個人。
engsen: Mrs Daly is an institution - she's been with the company for 40 years and knows absolutely everyone .

eng: an occasion when a law, system, etc. begins or is introduced
chisen: 《資訊自由法》的制定產生了深遠的影響。
engsen: The institution of the Freedom of Information Act has had a significant effect .

chi: 完整無缺的；未經觸動的
eng: complete and in the original state
chisen: 教堂在轟炸中被毀，但神壇卻完好無損。
engsen: The church was destroyed in the bombing but the altar survived intact .

chi: （使）融入（某社會或群體）；（使）成為一體
eng: to mix with and join society or a group of people, often changing to suit their way of life, habits, and customs
chisen: 他似乎覺得很難與別人打成一片。
engsen: He seems to find it difficult to integrate socially .

chi: （使）融入（某社會或群體）；（使）成為一體
eng: to mix with and join society or a group of people, often changing to suit their way of life, habits, and customs
chisen: 讓自己融入一個文化上完全不同的社會是非常困難的。
engsen: It's very difficult to integrate yourself into a society whose culture is so different from your own .

chi: （使）融入（某社會或群體）；（使）成為一體
eng: to mix with and join society or a group of people, often changing to suit their way of life, habits, and customs
chisen: 孩子通常很善於融入新的文化。
engsen: Children are often very good at integrating into a new culture .

eng: the quality of being honest and having strong moral principles that you refuse to change
chisen: 沒有人懷疑總裁是個光明磊落的人。
engsen: No one doubted that the president was a man of the highest integrity .

eng: the quality of being whole and complete
chisen: 在古老建築物上附加擴建的現代建築會破壞建築風格的完整統一。
engsen: A modern extension on the old building would ruin its architectural integrity .

eng: the ability to understand and to think in an intelligent way
chisen: 她的活力和才智得到了全世界的尊重。
engsen: Her energy and intellect are respected all over the world .

eng: the ability to understand and to think in an intelligent way
chisen: 相比其魅力，他的才智更為人矚目。
engsen: He is a man more noted for his intellect than his charm .

eng: an occasion when two lines cross, or the place where this happens
chisen: 圖上幾條線的交點就是我們開始盈利的地方。
engsen: The intersection of the lines on the graph marks the point where we start to make a profit .

eng: the place where two or more roads join or cross each other
chisen: 繁忙的十字路口
engsen: a busy intersection

eng: the place where two or more roads join or cross each other
chisen: 在下個十字路口向右轉。
engsen: Turn right at the next intersection .

eng: a period between two events or times
chisen: 我們定期見面——通常大約是每月一次。
engsen: We see each other at regular intervals - usually about once a month .

eng: the amount by which one note is higher or lower than another
chisen: 五度音程
engsen: an interval of a fifth (= between one note and another one four notes higher)

eng: to intentionally become involved in a difficult situation in order to improve it or prevent it from getting worse
chisen: 中央銀行今天對貨幣市場進行了干預，試圖穩定匯率。
engsen: The Central Bank intervened in the currency markets today to try to stabilize the exchange rate .

eng: to intentionally become involved in a difficult situation in order to improve it or prevent it from getting worse
chisen: 部長親自干預以阻止博物館的關閉。
engsen: The minister intervened personally to stop the museum from being closed .

eng: to happen between two times or between other events or activities
chisen: 從設計完成到劇場投入使用相隔20年。
engsen: Two decades intervened between the completion of the design and the opening of the theatre .

eng: a situation in which you have a close friendship or sexual relationship with someone
chisen: 不提倡師生之間關係過於密切。
engsen: Intimacy between teachers and students is not recommended .

eng: to frighten or threaten someone, usually in order to persuade them to do something that you want them to do
chisen: 他們因為受到失去工作的威脅而被迫同意減薪。
engsen: They were intimidated into accepting a pay cut by the threat of losing their jobs .

eng: to go into a place or situation in which you are not wanted or not expected to be
chisen: 瓊斯博士，我不知道您丈夫在這裡——但願我沒有打擾你們。
engsen: I didn't realize your husband was here , Dr Jones - I hope I'm not intruding .

eng: to go into a place or situation in which you are not wanted or not expected to be
chisen: 人們強烈要求報紙編輯不要煩擾失蹤軍人悲痛的家屬。
engsen: Newspaper editors are being urged not to intrude on/into the grief of the families of missing servicemen .

eng: someone who is in a place or situation where they are not wanted
chisen: 我拜訪他們家時總覺得自己像一名不速之客。
engsen: I feel like an intruder when I visit their home .

eng: extremely useful
chisen: 這份新工作將使你獲得寶貴的經驗。
engsen: The new job will provide you with invaluable experience .

eng: extremely useful
chisen: 這些資料對於研究人員來說將是非常寶貴的。
engsen: Such data will prove invaluable to/for researchers .

eng: a detailed list of all the things in a place
chisen: 這幢房子1736年的物品清單上列有一套雕花鍍金椅子，共24把。
engsen: A set of 24 gilded chairs appear on the inventory of the house for 1736 .

eng: a person whose job is to examine a crime, problem, statement, etc. in order to discover the truth
chisen: 調查人員研究了污染可能造成的後果。
engsen: Investigators have studied the possible effects of contamination .

eng: a person whose job is to examine a crime, problem, statement, etc. in order to discover the truth
chisen: 私家偵探
engsen: a private investigator

eng: abbreviation for intelligence quotient: a measure of someone's intelligence found from special tests
chisen: 低／高智商的孩子在學校常常會不順利。
engsen: Children with very low/high IQs often have problems at school .

eng: abbreviation for intelligence quotient: a measure of someone's intelligence found from special tests
chisen: 智商只是衡量智力的一種標準。
engsen: IQ is just one measure of intelligence .

chi: 具有諷刺意味的；出乎意料的；令人啼笑皆非的
eng: interesting, strange, or funny because of being very different from what you would usually expect
chisen: 諷刺的是，雖然如今很多物品的製作成本下降了，但能買得起的人卻少了。
engsen: It is ironic that although many items are now cheaper to make , fewer people can afford to buy them .

chi: 具有諷刺意味的情況；出乎意料的情況；令人啼笑皆非的事情
eng: a situation in which something which was intended to have a particular result has the opposite or a very different result
chisen: 諷刺的是，新的稅收制度反而將使該制度本來打算要幫助的人背上沉重負擔。
engsen: The irony (of it) is that the new tax system will burden those it was intended to help .

eng: the use of words that are the opposite of what you mean, as a way of being funny
chisen: 西蒙娜語氣裡明顯帶有諷刺地說：「你能留這麼久，我們真高興。」
engsen: Her voice heavy with irony , Simone said , "We're so pleased you were able to stay so long." (= Her voice made it obvious they were not pleased.)

eng: becoming annoyed very easily
chisen: 說話小心點——他今天脾氣很大。
engsen: Be careful what you say - he's rather irritable today .

eng: becoming annoyed very easily
chisen: 「不要再打擾我，」她煩躁地說。
engsen: "Don't disturb me again," she said in an irritable (= angry) voice .

eng: to make someone angry or annoyed
chisen: 過了一會兒兒，她的行為真讓我惱火了。
engsen: After a while her behaviour really began to irritate me .

eng: to make a part of your body sore or painful
chisen: 起初一戴上隱形眼鏡，我的眼睛就痛。
engsen: At first my contact lenses irritated my eyes .

eng: the feeling of being angry or annoyed, or something that makes you feel like this
chisen: 那種行為肯定會讓人感到惱火。
engsen: That kind of behaviour is sure to cause irritation .

eng: the feeling of being angry or annoyed, or something that makes you feel like this
chisen: 交通噪音只是煩人的瑣事之一。
engsen: Traffic noise is just one of several minor irritations (= small problems) .

eng: a painful or sore feeling in a part of the body
chisen: 這種殺菌乳膏適用於輕微的皮膚炎症。
engsen: It is an antiseptic cream suitable for minor skin irritations .

eng: a painful or sore feeling in a part of the body
chisen: 皮帶擦傷了他的皮膚引起了發炎。
engsen: The strap had rubbed against his skin and caused irritation .

eng: full of joy; very happy
chisen: 歡樂的讚歌／快樂的事／歡快的聲音
engsen: a joyous hymn/event/voice

eng: the most important part of something, although it might not always be easy to find
chisen: 他們的話裡常包含些真理。
engsen: There is often a kernel of truth in what they say .

eng: to take a person away illegally by force, usually in order to demand money in exchange for releasing them
chisen: 昨天晚上，一個商人的妻子在她倫敦的家中遭綁架。
engsen: The wife of a businessman was kidnapped from her home in London last night .

chi: 對…感到悲痛，對…表示失望，痛惜
eng: to express sadness and feeling sorry about something
chisen: 這首詩的開篇表達了對一位青年之死的惋惜之情。
engsen: The poem opens by lamenting (over) the death of a young man .

chi: 對…感到悲痛，對…表示失望，痛惜
eng: to express sadness and feeling sorry about something
chisen: 和往常一樣，我奶奶對當今社會世風日下深感痛惜。
engsen: My grandmother , as usual , lamented the decline in moral standards in today's society .

chi: 對…感到悲痛，對…表示失望，痛惜
eng: to express sadness and feeling sorry about something
chisen: 已故的受人愛戴的法蘭克‧焦托曾在此居住。
engsen: The late lamented (= dead and remembered with love) Frank Giotto used to live here .

eng: the way that something is arranged
chisen: 我喜歡這座房子的佈局。
engsen: I like the layout of the house .

eng: the way that something is arranged
chisen: 申請表在格式和篇幅上差別很大。
engsen: Application forms vary greatly in layout and length .

chi: 名聲顯赫的；津津樂道的
eng: very famous and admired or spoken about
chisen: 他當上了著名的愛爾蘭雜誌《鐘》的編輯。
engsen: He became editor of the legendary Irish journal "The Bell" .

chi: 名聲顯赫的；津津樂道的
eng: very famous and admired or spoken about
chisen: 英國人語言能力欠佳是出了名的。
engsen: The English are legendary (= well known) for their incompetence with languages .

eng: from a legend
chisen: 希臘傳奇英雄
engsen: a legendary Greek hero

eng: from a legend
chisen: 亞瑟王是確有其人還是一個傳說中的人物？
engsen: Was King Arthur a real or a legendary character ?

eng: relating to laws or the making of laws
chisen: 歐洲議會將獲得更大的立法權。
engsen: The European Parliament will have greater legislative powers (= ability to make laws) .

chi: 合法的，正當的，法律允許的
eng: allowed by law
chisen: 軍隊必須將權力交還給合法政府。
engsen: The army must give power back to the legitimate government .

eng: continuing for a long time
chisen: 漫長的討論／過程
engsen: a lengthy discussion/process

eng: continuing for a long time
chisen: 許多航空公司的乘客都因罷工而面臨漫長的延誤。
engsen: Many airline passengers face lengthy delays because of the strike .

chi: 承擔責任的；負有（法律）責任的
eng: having (legal) responsibility for something or someone
chisen: 法律規定孩子不上學父母要負責任。
engsen: The law holds parents liable if a child does not attend school .

chi: 承擔責任的；負有（法律）責任的
eng: having (legal) responsibility for something or someone
chisen: 如果我們輸掉了這場官司，就可能要承擔官司的全部費用。
engsen: If we lose the case we may be liable for (= have to pay) the costs of the whole trial .

chi: 很可能會發生的，可能性很大的
eng: very likely to do something
chisen: 這個城鎮靠近河邊的地區很容易遭到水淹。
engsen: The areas of town near the river are liable to flooding (= are often flooded) .

chi: 很可能會發生的，可能性很大的
eng: very likely to do something
chisen: 你如果把他吵醒了，他會大發雷霆的。
engsen: He's liable to make a fuss if you wake him .

eng: to help someone or something to be free
chisen: 他們稱他們向該國派出軍隊是要把那裡的人民／那個國家從獨裁者手中解放出來。
engsen: They said they sent troops in to liberate the people/the country from a dictator .

eng: an occasion when something or someone is released or made free
chisen: 解放被納粹佔領的法國
engsen: the liberation of France from Nazi occupation

eng: an occasion when something or someone is released or made free
chisen: 離開學校對我來說真是一種解脫。
engsen: Leaving school was such a liberation for me .

eng: in the same way
chisen: 這些植物一周澆兩次水，臥室裡的那些也一樣。
engsen: Just water these plants twice a week , and likewise the ones in the bedroom .

eng: the ability to read and write
chisen: 提高成年人的讀寫能力所需要的資源還遠遠不夠。
engsen: Far more resources are needed to improve adult literacy .

eng: the ability to read and write
chisen: 這個國家接近98%的人有讀寫能力。
engsen: The country has a literacy rate of almost 98% .

eng: The literal meaning of a word is its original, basic meaning.
chisen: television 的字面意思是「從遠處看」。
engsen: The literal meaning of "television" is "seeing from a distance" .

eng: The literal meaning of a word is its original, basic meaning.
chisen: 你需要顯示自己對文本的理解沒有僅僅停留在字面含義上。
engsen: You will need to show more than just a literal understanding of the text .

eng: living for a long time
chisen: 你的長壽歸功於哪些因素？
engsen: To what do you attribute your longevity ?

chi: （飯店、機場、劇院等的）休息廳，等候室
eng: a room in a hotel, airport, theatre, etc. where people can relax or wait
chisen: 機場候機廳
engsen: an airport lounge

chi: （飯店、機場、劇院等的）休息廳，等候室
eng: a room in a hotel, airport, theatre, etc. where people can relax or wait
chisen: 雞尾酒酒吧間
engsen: a cocktail lounge

eng: someone who behaves in a silly or dangerous way
chisen: 他開車像瘋子一樣。
engsen: He drives like a lunatic .

eng: the quality or power that something or someone has that makes it, him, or her attractive
chisen: 名譽／權力／金錢的誘惑
engsen: the lure of fame/power/money

chi: （地區）鬱鬱蔥蔥的，植被茂盛的
eng: A lush area has a lot of green, healthy plants, grass, and trees.
chisen: 鬱鬱蔥蔥的山谷
engsen: lush green valleys

chi: 美味的；愉悅的，使感官愉快的
eng: very attractive to look at, taste, smell, etc.
chisen: 管弦樂隊演奏的優美樂章
engsen: the lush sound of the orchestra

chi: 美味的；愉悅的，使感官愉快的
eng: very attractive to look at, taste, smell, etc.
chisen: 奶油軟糖霜淇淋的美味
engsen: the lush taste of fudge ice cream

eng: good or, of a person, attractive
chisen: 我生日那天，我們共度了一段美好的時光。
engsen: We had a lush time on my birthday .

eng: good or, of a person, attractive
chisen: 他真有吸引力。
engsen: He's so lush .

eng: the words of a song, especially a pop song
chisen: 保羅‧賽門的歌大多都是他自己寫的詞。
engsen: Paul Simon writes the lyrics for most of his songs .

eng: the large size or importance of something
chisen: 他們似乎沒有領會到問題的重要性。
engsen: They don't seem to grasp the magnitude of the problem .

chi: （常指以不正當手段）操縱，控制
eng: to control something or someone to your advantage, often unfairly or dishonestly
chisen: 她在整個職業生涯中非常成功地控制了媒體。
engsen: Throughout her career she has very successfully manipulated the media .

chi: （常指以不正當手段）操縱，控制
eng: to control something or someone to your advantage, often unfairly or dishonestly
chisen: 反對派領導人指責政府部長篡改統計數據以滿足自身利益。
engsen: The opposition leader accused government ministers of manipulating the statistics to suit themselves .

eng: to control something using the hands
chisen: 輪椅設計得很容易用手控制。
engsen: The wheelchair is designed so that it is easy to manipulate .

engsen: There is a lot of opposition to the proposed changes .

eng: a situation in which people are governed in an unfair and cruel way and prevented from having opportunities and freedom

eng: a situation in which people are governed in an unfair and cruel way and prevented from having opportunities and freedom

eng: a situation in which people are governed in an unfair and cruel way and prevented from having opportunities and freedom

engsen: English is compulsory for all students , but art and music are optional .

chi: （尤指疾病、危險或不快之事的）發作，暴發，突然發生

eng: (especially in the past) a person who has broken the law and who lives separately from the other parts of society because they want to escape legal punishment

engsen: a fast-food outlet

chi: 零售網點；經銷點；專賣店

chi: 駭人的；無恥的；無法接受的

eng: above your head, usually in the sky

eng: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or a private company to a person who does not work any more because they are too old or have become ill

engsen: a state pension .

eng: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or a private company to a person who does not work any more because they are too old or have become ill

eng: the way that objects appear smaller when they are further away and the way parallel lines appear to meet each other at a point in the distance

engsen: In 15th-century Italy , artists rediscovered the rules of perspective .

engsen: The pesticides that farmers spray on their crops kill pests , but they can also damage people's health .

engsen: We're entering a new phase in international relations .

engsen: Her paintings are almost photographic in their detail and accuracy .

engsen: The gun fires a shell capable of piercing the armour of an enemy tank .

engsen: an earthenware pitcher

eng: an unpleasant condition, especially a serious, sad, or difficult one

engsen: the plight of the poor/homeless

eng: an unpleasant condition, especially a serious, sad, or difficult one

engsen: Few of us can be unmoved by the plight of the refugees .

eng: to cook something such as a fish, or an egg with its shell removed, by putting it in gently boiling water or other liquid

engsen: Do you like pears poached in red wine ?

engsen: The river is populated mainly by smaller species of fish .
