eng: the way in which someone usually holds their shoulders, neck, and back, or a particular position in which someone stands, sits, etc.
chisen: 他在鏡頭前總是擺出同樣的姿勢。
engsen: He always adopts/assumes (= moves into) the same posture for the cameras .

eng: a way in which a government or other organization thinks about and/or deals with a particular matter
chisen: 本週反對派已是第三次攻擊政府的國防政策了。
engsen: For the third time this week the opposition has attacked the government's posture on defence .

eng: a way in which a government or other organization thinks about and/or deals with a particular matter
chisen: 女權主義發言人的口氣顯示她們的戒心相當重。
engsen: The tone of the feminist speakers suggested they were adopting a somewhat defensive posture .

chi: （指時間或空間上）處在…之前，先於
eng: to be or go before something or someone in time or space
chisen: 科菲•安南在潘基文之前擔任聯合國秘書長。
engsen: Kofi Annan preceded Ban Ki-moon as the Secretary-General of the UN .

chi: （指時間或空間上）處在…之前，先於
eng: to be or go before something or someone in time or space
chisen: 你幫這份報告加上一段引言會更好些。
engsen: It would be helpful if you were to precede the report with an introduction .

eng: an action, situation, or decision that has already happened and can be used as a reason why a similar action or decision should be performed or made
chisen: 提拔沒有正式學歷的人是有幾個先例的。
engsen: There are several precedents for promoting people who don't have formal qualifications .

eng: an action, situation, or decision that has already happened and can be used as a reason why a similar action or decision should be performed or made
chisen: 一些政客擔心同意讓步會開創危險的先例。
engsen: Some politicians fear that agreeing to the concession would set a dangerous precedent .

eng: the quality of being exact
chisen: 校準反光鏡需要極高的精確性。
engsen: Great precision is required to align the mirrors accurately .

eng: the quality of being exact
chisen: 精確轟炸被用來摧毀敵人的空軍基地和軍工廠。
engsen: Precision bombing was used to destroy enemy airbases and armaments factories .

eng: the qualities of being careful and accurate
chisen: 他的書讀起來賞心悅目，因為他的寫作清晰而又嚴謹。
engsen: His books are a pleasure to read because he writes with such clarity and precision .

chi: 前任，前輩；原有事物，前身
eng: someone who had a job or a position before someone else, or something that comes before another thing in time or in a series
chisen: 我的前任做這份工作做了12年。
engsen: My predecessor worked in this job for twelve years .

chi: 前任，前輩；原有事物，前身
eng: someone who had a job or a position before someone else, or something that comes before another thing in time or in a series
chisen: 最新款的法拉利賽車不僅比舊款的更快，而且更舒適。
engsen: The latest Ferrari is not only faster than its predecessors but also more comfortable .

eng: a statement about what you think will happen in the future
chisen: 請不要叫我對明天的會議進行預測。
engsen: Please don't ask me to make any predictions about tomorrow's meeting .

eng: a statement about what you think will happen in the future
chisen: 沒人相信她對於世界將在11月12日毀滅的預言。
engsen: No one believed her prediction that the world would end on 12 November .

eng: an introduction at the beginning of a book explaining its purpose, thanking people who helped the author, etc.
chisen: 在前言中，作者說他寫這本書花了八年。
engsen: In his preface , the author says that he took eight years to write the book .

eng: an unfair and unreasonable opinion or feeling, especially when formed without enough thought or knowledge
chisen: 禁止種族歧視的法律必須嚴格執行。
engsen: Laws against racial prejudice must be strictly enforced .

eng: an unfair and unreasonable opinion or feeling, especially when formed without enough thought or knowledge
chisen: 這項運動旨在消除愛滋病僅限於同性戀群體的偏見。
engsen: The campaign aims to dispel the prejudice that AIDS is confined to the homosexual community .

eng: an unfair and unreasonable opinion or feeling, especially when formed without enough thought or knowledge
chisen: 他主張如果國內所有的同性戀明星都能對自己的性向開誠布公，那麼對同性戀者的偏見就會立即消失。
engsen: He claims that prejudice against homosexuals would cease overnight if all the gay stars in the country were honest about their sexuality .

eng: coming before a more important action or event, especially introducing or preparing for it
chisen: 初查結果顯示疫苗是有效的，但這有待於進一步醫學實驗的證實。
engsen: Preliminary results show that the vaccine is effective , but this has to be confirmed by further medical trials .

eng: coming before a more important action or event, especially introducing or preparing for it
chisen: 我們決定依據初步調查的結果對設計方案進行更改。
engsen: We've decided to change the design based on our preliminary findings .

chi: 過早的；不成熟的；倉促的
eng: happening or done too soon, especially before the natural or suitable time
chisen: 早產兒
engsen: a premature baby

chi: 過早的；不成熟的；倉促的
eng: happening or done too soon, especially before the natural or suitable time
chisen: 鑒於結果尚未知曉，他們的批評似乎為時過早。
engsen: Their criticisms seem premature considering that the results aren't yet known .

eng: best or most important
chisen: 他是該國最重要的科學家之一。
engsen: He's one of the nation's premier scientists .

eng: (of a doctor) to say what medical treatment someone should have
chisen: 這種藥通常是開來治療潰瘍的。
engsen: The drug is often prescribed for ulcers .

eng: (of a doctor) to say what medical treatment someone should have
chisen: 醫生給我開了些止痛藥。
engsen: I've been prescribed painkillers .

eng: to tell someone what they must have or do, or to make a rule of something
chisen: 法律上規定了不繳稅的懲罰措施。
engsen: Penalties for not paying taxes are prescribed by law .

eng: to tell someone what they must have or do, or to make a rule of something
chisen: 法律規定所有孩子必須上學。
engsen: The law prescribes that all children must go to school .

eng: to tell someone what they must have or do, or to make a rule of something
chisen: 文法規則對單字如何搭配使用作出了規定。
engsen: Grammatical rules prescribe how words may be used together .

chi: 處方，藥方；處方上開的藥
eng: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes the details of the medicine or drugs that someone needs
chisen: 醫生的處方
engsen: a doctor's prescription

chi: 處方，藥方；處方上開的藥
eng: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes the details of the medicine or drugs that someone needs
chisen: 鎮靜劑的處方
engsen: a prescription for sedatives

chi: 處方，藥方；處方上開的藥
eng: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes the details of the medicine or drugs that someone needs
chisen: 醫生應該給你開個重複處方。
engsen: The doctor should give you a repeat prescription (= another piece of paper allowing more of the same medicine to be given , often without the person seeing the doctor again) .

eng: the act of telling someone else what they must have or do
chisen: 那麼他認為成功的訣竅是甚麼？
engsen: So what is his prescription for success ?

eng: to be in charge of a formal meeting, ceremony, or trial
chisen: 誰來主持大眾調查最合適呢？
engsen: Who would be the best person to preside at/over the public enquiry ?

eng: to be in charge of a formal meeting, ceremony, or trial
chisen: 蘭代爾法官將主持這個案子的正式調查。
engsen: Judge Langdale is to preside over the official enquiry into the case .

eng: the job of being president, or the period when someone is a president
chisen: 他已宣佈參加總統競選。
engsen: He has announced that he is running for the presidency .

eng: the job of being president, or the period when someone is a president
chisen: 她以高額票數當選總統。
engsen: She won the presidency by a wide margin .

eng: respect and admiration given to someone or something, usually because of a reputation for high quality, success, or social influence
chisen: 該公司贏得了國際聲譽。
engsen: The company has gained international prestige .

eng: respect and admiration given to someone or something, usually because of a reputation for high quality, success, or social influence
chisen: 在一家一流公司工作令人羡慕，很多人因此心向神往。
engsen: Many people are attracted by the prestige of working for a top company .

eng: to believe something to be true because it is very likely, although you are not certain
chisen: 鑒於他們沒有回覆邀請，我認為他們不會來了。
engsen: I presume (that) they're not coming , since they haven't replied to the invitation .

eng: to believe something to be true because it is very likely, although you are not certain
chisen: 我想你是史密斯博士吧？
engsen: You are Dr Smith , I presume ?

eng: to believe something to be true because it is very likely, although you are not certain
chisen: 「我們要步行到旅館嗎？」「我想不是／是的。」
engsen: "Are we walking to the hotel?" "I presume not/so."

eng: to do something although you know that you do not have a right to do it
chisen: 我不想冒昧地教你該如何工作，但這個零件不是應該裝在那裡嗎？
engsen: I wouldn't presume to tell you how to do your job , but shouldn't this piece go there ?

eng: to do something although you know that you do not have a right to do it
chisen: 恕我冒昧，但你難道不覺得應該向她道歉嗎？
engsen: I don't wish to presume (= make a suggestion although I have no right to) , but don't you think you should apologize to her ?

eng: to do something although you know that you do not have a right to do it
chisen: 他利用了她的善良本性。
engsen: He presumes on her good nature (= takes unfair advantage of it) .

eng: intended to stop something before it happens
chisen: 過去十年內，預防措施大大降低了兒童齲齒的發生。
engsen: In the past ten years , preventive measures have radically reduced levels of tooth decay in children .

eng: the rate at which a company or country makes goods, usually judged in connection with the number of people and the amount of materials necessary to produce the goods
chisen: 研究顯示如果工作環境舒適，生產效率會提高。
engsen: Studies show that if a working environment is pleasant , productivity increases .

eng: the rate at which a company or country makes goods, usually judged in connection with the number of people and the amount of materials necessary to produce the goods
chisen: 生產效率獎金／激勵
engsen: a productivity bonus/incentive

eng: the rate at which a company or country makes goods, usually judged in connection with the number of people and the amount of materials necessary to produce the goods
chisen: 鋼鐵工業的生產率去年提高了5%。
engsen: Productivity in the steel industry improved by five percent last year .

eng: felt or experienced very strongly or in an extreme way
chisen: 他六歲時母親的過世對他的影響很大。
engsen: His mother's death when he was aged six had a very profound effect on him .

eng: felt or experienced very strongly or in an extreme way
chisen: 避孕藥的發明為女性的生活帶來了重大變化。
engsen: The invention of the contraceptive pill brought about profound changes in the lives of women .

eng: felt or experienced very strongly or in an extreme way
chisen: 那兩行詩貼切表達了失去親人的深切悲痛。
engsen: Those two lines of poetry express perfectly the profound sadness of loss .

eng: showing a clear and deep understanding of serious matters
chisen: 我看過的評論說它是一部「有創意、有深度的電影」。
engsen: The review that I read said that it was "a thoughtful and profound film" .

eng: showing a clear and deep understanding of serious matters
chisen: 「死很容易——活下去才是難題。」「史蒂文，你的話真深奧！」
engsen: "Dying is easy - it's living that's the problem." "That was very profound of you , Steven."

eng: developing or happening gradually
chisen: 最近幾年的生活水準每況愈下。
engsen: There's been a progressive decline in the standard of living over the past few years .

eng: developing or happening gradually
chisen: 慢性病
engsen: a progressive disease

chi: （指思想或體制）進步的，先進的
eng: Progressive ideas or systems are new and modern, encouraging change in society or in the way that things are done.
chisen: 該政黨的左派人士敦促實行更加進步的社會政策。
engsen: The left of the party is pressing for a more progressive social policy .

chi: （指思想或體制）進步的，先進的
eng: Progressive ideas or systems are new and modern, encouraging change in society or in the way that things are done.
chisen: 實行漸進式教學的學校
engsen: a progressive school

eng: The progressive form of a verb is used to show that the action is continuing. It is formed with the verb "be" followed by the present participle (= -ing form of the verb).
chisen: He's working hard at the moment 是動詞 work 的現在進行式的一個例子。
engsen: "He's working hard at the moment" is an example of the present progressive form of the verb "work" .

eng: The progressive form of a verb is used to show that the action is continuing. It is formed with the verb "be" followed by the present participle (= -ing form of the verb).
chisen: I was eating when the phone rang 是過去進行式的一個例子。
engsen: "I was eating when the phone rang" is an example of the past progressive .

eng: to officially refuse to allow something
chisen: 機動車輛禁止在市中心行駛。
engsen: Motor vehicles are prohibited from driving in the town centre .

eng: to officially refuse to allow something
chisen: 政府頒布了一項法律： 禁止在電視上播放煙草廣告。
engsen: The government introduced a law prohibiting tobacco advertisements on TV .

eng: to officially refuse to allow something
chisen: 這些大門之間嚴禁停車。
engsen: Parking is strictly prohibited between these gates .

eng: the act of officially not allowing something, or an order that does this
chisen: 紐約市宣佈禁止在公共汽車上吸煙。
engsen: New York City has announced a prohibition on smoking on buses .

eng: the act of officially not allowing something, or an order that does this
chisen: 該環保團體要求徹底禁止捕獵鯨魚。
engsen: The environmental group is demanding a complete prohibition against the hunting of whales .

eng: the act of officially not allowing something, or an order that does this
chisen: 我覺得花錢禁毒不如把錢用在資訊和教育上。
engsen: It's my feeling that the money spent on drug prohibition would be better spent on information and education .

eng: a calculation or guess about the future based on information that you have
chisen: 這家公司未能達到去年的預期銷售目標，還差30%。
engsen: The company has failed to achieve last year's sales projections by 30 percent .

chi: 易於遭受（疾病）的；有（消極）傾向的
eng: likely to suffer from an illness or show a particular negative characteristic
chisen: 我總是容易頭痛。
engsen: I've always been prone to headaches .

chi: 易於遭受（疾病）的；有（消極）傾向的
eng: likely to suffer from an illness or show a particular negative characteristic
chisen: 甚至在青少年時期他就容易情緒抑鬱。
engsen: He was prone to depression even as a teenager .

chi: 易於遭受（疾病）的；有（消極）傾向的
eng: likely to suffer from an illness or show a particular negative characteristic
chisen: 她喜歡誇大其詞，這一點是肯定的。
engsen: She's prone to exaggerate , that's for sure .

eng: lying face down
chisen: 這張照片上一名男子趴在人行道上，頭部周圍有一灘血。
engsen: The photograph showed a man lying prone on the pavement , a puddle of blood around his head .

eng: information, ideas, opinions, or images, often only giving one part of an argument, that are broadcast, published, or in some other way spread with the intention of influencing people's opinions
chisen: 在學校時我們被灌輸了共產主義／右翼思想。
engsen: At school we were fed communist/right-wing propaganda .

eng: information, ideas, opinions, or images, often only giving one part of an argument, that are broadcast, published, or in some other way spread with the intention of influencing people's opinions
chisen: 一名官員將停火斥為赤裸裸的宣傳伎倆。
engsen: One official dismissed the ceasefire as a mere propaganda exercise .

eng: to push or move something somewhere, often with a lot of force
chisen: 在推力作用下穿越外太空的火箭
engsen: a rocket propelled through space

eng: to push or move something somewhere, often with a lot of force
chisen: 「太陽神康提基號」帆船借助風力橫渡了太平洋。
engsen: The Kon-Tiki sailed across the Pacific Ocean propelled by wind power .

eng: written language in its ordinary form rather than poetry
chisen: 我一直偏好讀散文而不是詩歌。
engsen: I've always preferred reading prose to poetry .

eng: to officially accuse someone of committing a crime in a law court, or (of a lawyer) to try to prove that a person accused of committing a crime is guilty of that crime
chisen: 商店扒手將遭到起訴。
engsen: Shoplifters will be prosecuted .

eng: to officially accuse someone of committing a crime in a law court, or (of a lawyer) to try to prove that a person accused of committing a crime is guilty of that crime
chisen: 他因詐騙而被起訴。
engsen: He was prosecuted for fraud .

eng: to officially accuse someone of committing a crime in a law court, or (of a lawyer) to try to prove that a person accused of committing a crime is guilty of that crime
chisen: 對任何不遵守標準的生產商都可依據1987年通過的《消費者保護法》予以起訴。
engsen: Any manufacturer who does not conform to the standards could be prosecuted under the Consumers Protection Act , 1987 .

chi: 把…進行到底，繼續參與（尤指戰爭）
eng: to continue to take part in a planned group of activities, especially a war
chisen: 他似乎確信美國會將這場戰爭進行到底。
engsen: He seemed convinced that the US would prosecute the war to its end .

eng: the act of prosecuting someone
chisen: 這些案件中有數宗是最後成功提起訴訟的。
engsen: A number of the cases have resulted in successful prosecution .

eng: the act of prosecuting someone
chisen: 怠忽職守的醫生很可能會被起訴。
engsen: Doctors guilty of neglect are liable to prosecution .

chi: 潛在的客戶／可能成為僱主的人／即將為人父母者等
eng: people who are expected to buy something, employ someone, become parents, etc.
chisen: 已經有三批可能買我們房子的人來看過房子了。
engsen: We've had three sets of prospective buyers looking at the house .

chi: 激起，引起（尤指負面反應）
eng: to cause a reaction, especially a negative one
chisen: 物價上漲的預測已經引發了強烈抗議。
engsen: The prospect of increased prices has already provoked an outcry .

chi: 激起，引起（尤指負面反應）
eng: to cause a reaction, especially a negative one
chisen: 檢測結果引發了核子反應爐可能過熱的擔憂。
engsen: Test results provoked worries that the reactor could overheat .

eng: to make or try to make a person or an animal angry
chisen: 那隻狗看起來很凶，我並不想招惹它。
engsen: It was a vicious-looking dog and I didn't want to provoke it .

eng: to make or try to make a person or an animal angry
chisen: 他分明想攻擊我，但我就是不生氣。
engsen: He was clearly trying to get at me but I refused to be provoked .

eng: to make or try to make a person or an animal angry
chisen: 我被激怒，於是吵了起來。
engsen: I was provoked into the argument .

chi: （打獵等時）悄悄來回游走（於），潛行，逡巡
eng: to move around quietly in a place trying not to be seen or heard, such as an animal does when hunting
chisen: 有人報告說有一個蒙面人在附近出沒。
engsen: There have been reports of a masked man prowling in the neighbourhood .

chi: （打獵等時）悄悄來回游走（於），潛行，逡巡
eng: to move around quietly in a place trying not to be seen or heard, such as an animal does when hunting
chisen: 在夜晚，成年蠍子在沙漠裡潛行覓食昆蟲。
engsen: At night , adult scorpions prowl the desert for (= trying to catch) insects .

chi: （打獵等時）悄悄來回游走（於），潛行，逡巡
eng: to move around quietly in a place trying not to be seen or heard, such as an animal does when hunting
chisen: 他睡不著，就在旅館的走廊上徘徊。
engsen: Unable to sleep , he prowled (= walked without purpose) (about/around) the hotel corridors .

eng: arriving, doing something, or happening at the expected, correct time; not late
chisen: 準時開會
engsen: a punctual start to the meeting

eng: arriving, doing something, or happening at the expected, correct time; not late
chisen: 他通常非常準時。
engsen: He's fairly punctual (= he usually arrives on time) .

eng: to remove bad substances from something to make it pure
chisen: 植物有助於淨化空氣。
engsen: Plants help to purify the air .

eng: to remove bad substances from something to make it pure
chisen: 腎臟的功能之一是淨化血液。
engsen: One of the functions of the kidneys is to purify the blood .

eng: to remove immoral thoughts or acts from something
chisen: 佛教的主要教義之一是人應該努力淨化自己的思想。
engsen: One of the main teachings of Buddhism is that you should try to purify your mind .

eng: the state of not being mixed with anything else
chisen: 以種族純化的名義所實施的暴行
engsen: the atrocities carried out in the name of ethnic/racial purity

eng: the quality of being morally good or the state of not having sex
chisen: 孩子們的天真無邪
engsen: the purity and innocence of children

eng: the quality of being morally good or the state of not having sex
chisen: 對基督徒來說，聖母瑪莉亞是貞潔的象徵。
engsen: For Christians , the Virgin Mary is a symbol of purity .

eng: an official record showing that you have finished a training course or have the necessary skills, etc.
chisen: 你要是沒有任何資格證明就永遠得不到一份好工作。
engsen: You'll never get a good job if you don't have any qualifications .

eng: an official record showing that you have finished a training course or have the necessary skills, etc.
chisen: 你有沒有教師/法律/醫學/秘書/學術的資格證明？
engsen: Do you have any teaching/legal/medical/secretarial/academic qualifications ?

eng: success in getting into a competition
chisen: 這場勝利讓他們獲得了參加世界盃決賽的資格。
engsen: The win earned them qualification for the World Cup finals .

eng: an extra piece of information that limits the effect of something that you say or write
chisen: 醫生說我可以今天出院，不過條件是要每天回來換繃帶。
engsen: The doctor said I can leave hospital today , but with the qualification that I have to come back every day to get the dressing changed .

eng: to drink liquid so that you stop being thirsty
chisen: 大熱天裡最好喝水解渴。
engsen: When it's hot , it's best to quench your thirst with water .

eng: a question, often expressing doubt about something or looking for an answer from an authority
chisen: 您如果對治療有任何疑問，醫生將會做出解答。
engsen: If you have any queries about your treatment , the doctor will answer them .

eng: a list of questions that several people are asked so that information can be collected about something
chisen: 訪問該國的遊客被要求填寫一份詳細的調查表。
engsen: Visitors to the country have been asked to fill in a detailed questionnaire .

chi: 種族主義；種族歧視，種族迫害
eng: the belief that people's qualities are influenced by their race and that the members of other races are not as good as the members of your own, or the resulting unfair treatment of members of other races
chisen: 當局將採取措施反對／打擊／應對各學校中的種族歧視。
engsen: The authorities are taking steps to combat/fight/tackle racism in schools .

chi: 種族主義；種族歧視，種族迫害
eng: the belief that people's qualities are influenced by their race and that the members of other races are not as good as the members of your own, or the resulting unfair treatment of members of other races
chisen: 報告明確指出，該國各組織機構中都存在著根深蒂固的種族偏見。
engsen: The report made it plain that institutional racism (= racism in all parts of an organization) is deep-rooted in this country .

chi: 喜氣洋洋的；容光煥發的；光彩照人的
eng: obviously very happy, or very beautiful
chisen: 當他聽到她的消息時，臉上綻放出燦爛的笑容。
engsen: He gave a radiant smile when he heard her news .

chi: （熱或光）輻射的，放射的，發散的
eng: producing heat or light
chisen: 輻射加熱器
engsen: a radiant heater

chi: （熱或光）輻射的，放射的，發散的
eng: producing heat or light
chisen: 太陽的輻射熱
engsen: the radiant heat of the sun

eng: to produce heat and/or light, or (of heat or light) to be produced
chisen: 木星內部散發出的熱量是它吸收太陽熱量的兩倍。
engsen: The planet Jupiter radiates twice as much heat from inside as it receives from the Sun .

eng: to produce heat and/or light, or (of heat or light) to be produced
chisen: 一束光從燈塔射出。
engsen: A single beam of light radiated from the lighthouse .

eng: to show an emotion or quality, or (of an emotion or quality) to be shown or felt
chisen: 他顯得快樂而又幸福。
engsen: He was radiating joy and happiness .

eng: to show an emotion or quality, or (of an emotion or quality) to be shown or felt
chisen: 她熱情洋溢。
engsen: Enthusiasm was radiating from her .

chi: 從中心散開；呈輻射狀發出
eng: to spread out in all directions from a central point
chisen: 滾滾熔岩從火山口流向四面八方。
engsen: Flows of lava radiated out from the volcano's crater .

chi: 從中心散開；呈輻射狀發出
eng: to spread out in all directions from a central point
chisen: 每當繁殖季節即將來臨，這些鳥飛向四面八方，遷徙到氣候較溫暖的地帶。
engsen: Just before the breeding season , these birds radiate outwards to warmer climates .

eng: a form of energy that comes from a nuclear reaction and that can be very dangerous to health
chisen: 很多軍人在早期的原子彈試爆後患上了輻射病。
engsen: Many servicemen suffered radiation sickness after the early atomic tests .

chi: （通常指依靠水迴圈的）暖氣裝置；散熱器；冷卻器
eng: a device, usually a container filled with water, that sends out heat, often as part of a heating or cooling system
chisen: 我們安裝中央供暖系統時，在每個房間都安了散熱器。
engsen: When we installed the central heating , we put a radiator in every room .

chi: （通常指依靠水迴圈的）暖氣裝置；散熱器；冷卻器
eng: a device, usually a container filled with water, that sends out heat, often as part of a heating or cooling system
chisen: 我的汽車引擎過熱，原因是散熱器漏水。
engsen: My car engine overheated because the water had leaked out of the radiator .

eng: believing or expressing the belief that there should be great or extreme social or political change
chisen: 他是個著名的激進改革者／思想家／政治家。
engsen: He was known as a radical reformer/thinker/politician .

eng: believing or expressing the belief that there should be great or extreme social or political change
chisen: 這些人觀點很偏激。
engsen: These people have very radical views .

eng: relating to the most important parts of something or someone; complete or extreme
chisen: 我們需要對操作流程進行一些根本性的變革。
engsen: We need to make some radical changes to our operating procedures .

eng: relating to the most important parts of something or someone; complete or extreme
chisen: 我正把頭髮剪短一下——沒什麼大改變。
engsen: I'm just having my hair trimmed - nothing radical .

chi: （指移除所有患病組織）根本的
eng: aimed at removing all diseased tissue
chisen: 宮頸癌如果僅限於盆骨或周邊淋巴結時，可以採用根除性手術治癒。
engsen: Cervical cancer may be cured with radical surgery when it is confined to the pelvis or regional lymph nodes .

eng: a flat floating structure for travelling across water, often made of pieces of wood tied roughly together and moved along with a paddle (= pole with a flat end)
chisen: 我們把所有能漂浮的東西都捆綁在一起來做一個筏子。
engsen: We lashed together anything that would float to make a raft .

eng: a large number or range; a lot
chisen: 大量資料
engsen: a raft of data

eng: a large number or range; a lot
chisen: 我們已經制定了一整套措施來完善交通系統。
engsen: We have designed a whole raft of measures to improve the transport system .

chi: （通常由一小隊人發起的）突襲，襲擊
eng: a short sudden attack, usually by a small group of people
chisen: 突擊隊大膽（向敵人）發起了突襲。
engsen: The commandos made/staged/carried out a daring raid (on the enemy) .

chi: （通常由一小隊人發起的）突襲，襲擊
eng: a short sudden attack, usually by a small group of people
chisen: 執行空襲轟炸任務的飛機
engsen: planes on a bombing raid

eng: happening, done, or chosen by chance rather than according to a plan
chisen: 我們隨機挑選一些人，問了他們的想法。
engsen: We asked a random sample/selection of people what they thought .

eng: a large amount of money that is demanded in exchange for someone who has been taken prisoner, or sometimes for an animal
chisen: 索要贖金／勒索贖金的字條
engsen: a ransom demand/note

eng: a large amount of money that is demanded in exchange for someone who has been taken prisoner, or sometimes for an animal
chisen: 他們索要钜額贖金作爲放回被綁小女孩的條件。
engsen: They demanded a huge ransom for the return of the little girl whom they had kidnapped .

eng: a large amount of money that is demanded in exchange for someone who has been taken prisoner, or sometimes for an animal
chisen: 這個犯罪集團扣留了賽馬，以此勒索贖金。
engsen: The gang held the racehorse to/for ransom .

eng: a lot of small red spots on the skin
chisen: 我胸部出滿了疹子，癢得要命。
engsen: I've got an itchy rash all over my chest .

eng: a lot of small red spots on the skin
chisen: 如果你在陽光下呆得太久，就會生痱子。
engsen: If you stay in the sun too long you'll get (a) heat rash .

eng: a lot of small red spots on the skin
chisen: 他摔倒在一片蕁麻地裡，結果身上就起了疹子。
engsen: He came out/up in a rash after he fell in a patch of nettles .

chi: （一下子出現的）大量令人不快的事
eng: a large number of unpleasant events of the same type
chisen: 過去兩個月中，突然發生很多起搶劫案／一下出了很多宗事故／接二連三收到多宗投訴。
engsen: There has been a rash of robberies/accidents/complaints in the last two months .

eng: based on clear thought and reason
chisen: 對發生的事一定有一個理性的解釋。
engsen: There must be some rational explanation for what happened .

eng: based on clear thought and reason
chisen: 理智的行為／行動方案
engsen: a rational act/course of action

eng: based on clear thought and reason
chisen: 理智的辯論／決定
engsen: a rational argument/decision

eng: to cause great damage to something
chisen: 這一地區飽受乾旱／洪水／戰爭的蹂躪。
engsen: The area has been ravaged by drought/floods/war .

chi: 現實（性）；務實作風；注重實際
eng: a way of thinking and acting based on facts and what is possible, rather than on hopes for things that are unlikely to happen
chisen: 他決定不擴大經營規模，這顯示了他腳踏實地的務實作風。
engsen: His decision not to expand the business shows his down-to-earth realism .

chi: （繪畫、電影、書籍等的）現實主義，現實主義風格
eng: paintings, films, books, etc. that try to represent life as it really is
chisen: 導演運用了手提式攝像機實拍手法，增加了影片的真實感。
engsen: The director used handheld camera techniques to add to the gritty realism of the film .

eng: the fact or moment of starting to understand a situation
chisen: 人們開始意識到這是一場大災難。
engsen: The realization was dawning that this was a major disaster .

eng: the act or moment of achieving something you planned to do or hoped for
chisen: 贏得奧運會金牌就實現了他平生的夙願。
engsen: To win the Olympic gold medal was the realization of his life's dream .

eng: the act of getting money by selling something
chisen: 即使變賣他所有的資産也無法使他免於破産。
engsen: Even the realization of all his assets would not be enough to prevent financial ruin .

eng: violent action organized by a group of people who are trying to change the political system in their country
chisen: 政府殘酷鎮壓了叛亂。
engsen: The government has brutally crushed the rebellion .

eng: a period when the economy of a country is not successful and conditions for business are bad
chisen: 這個國家一步步滑入經濟衰退的谷底。
engsen: The country is sliding into the depths of (a) recession .

eng: a person who receives something
chisen: 過去獲得過諾貝爾和平獎的包括吉米·卡特和巴拉克·歐巴馬。
engsen: Former Nobel Peace Prize recipients include Jimmy Carter and Barack Obama .

eng: a person who receives something
chisen: 他被授予平民服務獎章。
engsen: He was a recipient of the Civilian Service Award .

eng: a suggestion that something is good or suitable for a particular purpose or job
chisen: 我買的這台電腦是約翰推薦的。
engsen: I bought this computer on John's recommendation (= because John told me that it was good) .

eng: a suggestion that something is good or suitable for a particular purpose or job
chisen: 我是透過森姆的推薦得到這份工作的。
engsen: I got the job on Sam's recommendation (= because she told her employers that I was suitable for the job) .

eng: to find a way in which two situations or beliefs that are opposed to each other can agree and exist together
chisen: 有時很難調和宗教和科學之間的矛盾。
engsen: It is sometimes difficult to reconcile science and religion .

eng: to find a way in which two situations or beliefs that are opposed to each other can agree and exist together
chisen: 差別如此懸殊的觀點是很難達成一致的。
engsen: It's difficult to reconcile such different points of view .

eng: to find a way in which two situations or beliefs that are opposed to each other can agree and exist together
chisen: 如果你愛動物，那怎麽還穿毛皮大衣呢？
engsen: How can you reconcile your fur coat and/with your love of animals ?

eng: a drug taken for pleasure
chisen: 處方止痛藥被用作了消遣性毒品。
engsen: Prescription painkillers are being used as recreational drugs .

chi: 招聘，吸收；（尤指軍隊）徵募新兵
eng: to persuade someone to work for a company or become a new member of an organization, especially the army
chisen: 諸如樂施會這樣的慈善組織總是在盡力吸收志願者來幫助他們工作。
engsen: Charities such as Oxfam are always trying to recruit volunteers to help in their work .

chi: 招聘，吸收；（尤指軍隊）徵募新兵
eng: to persuade someone to work for a company or become a new member of an organization, especially the army
chisen: 就連很年輕的男生都被徵召入伍了。
engsen: Even young boys are now being recruited into the army .

chi: 招聘，吸收；（尤指軍隊）徵募新兵
eng: to persuade someone to work for a company or become a new member of an organization, especially the army
chisen: 新兵徵募中心／軍官
engsen: an army recruiting centre/officer

chi: 反復出現；再次發生；重新産生
eng: to happen many times or to happen again
chisen: 自由這一主題在她的寫作中反復出現。
engsen: The theme of freedom recurs throughout her writing .

chi: 反復出現；再次發生；重新産生
eng: to happen many times or to happen again
chisen: 如果疼痛復發／問題再出現／再感不適等，就來找我。
engsen: If the pain/problem/trouble , etc . recurs , come and see me .

chi: （尤指詞、片語等）多餘的，不需要的，累贅的，囉唆的
eng: (especially of a word, phrase, etc.) unnecessary because it is more than is needed
chisen: 在句子 She is a single unmarried woman 中，unmarried 一詞是多餘的。
engsen: In the sentence "She is a single unmarried woman" , the word "unmarried" is redundant .

chi: 失業的，被解僱的，被裁減的
eng: having lost your job because your employer no longer needs you
chisen: 為了使公司生存下去，一半的僱員要被裁掉。
engsen: To keep the company alive , half the workforce is being made redundant .

chi: 失業的，被解僱的，被裁減的
eng: having lost your job because your employer no longer needs you
chisen: 新技術常常會使古老的技藝甚至是某個行業完全消失。
engsen: New technology often makes old skills and even whole communities redundant .

chi: （尤指去除不需要的雜質而）精煉，提煉，提純
eng: to make something pure or improve something, especially by removing unwanted material
chisen: 原油經過工業提煉來提純並且分離出諸如苯之類的不同元素。
engsen: Crude oil is industrially refined to purify it and separate out the different elements , such as benzene .

eng: the process of making a substance pure
chisen: 生鴉片經過提煉産生其他藥物，如嗎啡。
engsen: The refinement of raw opium yields other drugs , such as morphine .

eng: a quality of politeness and education
chisen: 她是文化與教養的化身。
engsen: She's the personification of culture and refinement .

eng: thinking carefully and quietly
chisen: 聽到這個消息後，他們都一聲不吭地坐著，陷入了沈思。
engsen: After hearing the news they sat in a quiet , reflective silence .

eng: (small amounts of) food and drink
chisen: 他在一家小吃店前停下買些點心飲料。
engsen: He stopped at a bar for a little refreshment .

eng: (small amounts of) food and drink
chisen: 會堂後面將會供應簡單的茶點。
engsen: Light refreshments will be available at the back of the hall .

chi: （尤指因為對購買的産品或服務不滿意而追回的）退款，返還款，償還金額
eng: an amount of money that is given back to you, especially because you are not happy with a product or service that you have bought
chisen: 我把收音機拿回商店，讓他們退款／堅決要求店方退款／得到了退款／他們給我辦理了退款。
engsen: I took the radio back to the shop and asked for/demanded/got/was given a refund .

chi: 不管怎樣，無論如何；不管，不顧
eng: despite; not being affected by something
chisen: 儘管遭到當地居民的反對，新建高層辦公大樓的計劃還是付諸實施了。
engsen: The plan for a new office building went ahead regardless of local opposition .

chi: 不管怎樣，無論如何；不管，不顧
eng: despite; not being affected by something
chisen: 雖然她知道除了晚上別的時候去看他都很危險，可她還是（不顧危險）動身去了。
engsen: She knew it was dangerous to visit him except at night , but she set out regardless (of the risk) .

chi: 不管怎樣，無論如何；不管，不顧
eng: despite; not being affected by something
chisen: 這份工作任何人都可以應聘，不管其以前的工作經歷如何。
engsen: This job is open to all , regardless of previous experience .

eng: a particular government or a system or method of government
chisen: 腐敗的舊極權政府被推翻。
engsen: The old corrupt , totalitarian regime was overthrown .

eng: a time when all the people involved in a play, dance, etc. practise in order to prepare for a performance
chisen: 他們演出前根本就沒有時間試演。
engsen: They didn't have time for (a) rehearsal before the performance .

eng: a time when all the people involved in a play, dance, etc. practise in order to prepare for a performance
chisen: 他是個製片人，他的三部劇現在都在排演中。
engsen: He's a producer with three plays in rehearsal .

eng: to practise a play, a piece of music, etc. in order to prepare it for public performance
chisen: 樂師們為音樂會排練（交響曲）。
engsen: The musicians rehearsed (the symphony) for the concert .

eng: to practise a play, a piece of music, etc. in order to prepare it for public performance
chisen: 在去面試的路上，她默誦了一下要說的內容。
engsen: On her way to her interview she silently rehearsed what she would say .

eng: a long, thin piece of material, especially leather, that helps you to control and direct a horse
chisen: 拉兩邊的繮繩來讓馬停住或放慢速度，但是要想左轉時，只需拉左邊的繮繩。
engsen: You pull on both reins to stop or slow a horse , but only the left rein to turn left .

eng: to make something stronger
chisen: 我牛仔褲的口袋縫了兩道線，很結實。
engsen: The pockets on my jeans are reinforced with double stitching .

eng: to repeat something you have heard, or to broadcast a signal, message, or programme on television or radio
chisen: 我是第一個被告知這消息的人，接著我又轉告了其他人。
engsen: I was told the news first and then I relayed it to the others .

eng: to repeat something you have heard, or to broadcast a signal, message, or programme on television or radio
chisen: 有關戰爭的電視新聞圖片透過衛星在全世界進行了轉播。
engsen: TV pictures of the war were relayed around the world by satellite .

chi: 有關的；相關聯的；切題的
eng: connected with what is happening or being discussed
chisen: 教育應和孩子的需要掛鈎。
engsen: Education should be relevant to the child's needs .

chi: 有關的；相關聯的；切題的
eng: connected with what is happening or being discussed
chisen: 欲知詳情，請參閱有關單頁廣告。
engsen: For further information , please refer to the relevant leaflet .

chi: 有關的；相關聯的；切題的
eng: connected with what is happening or being discussed
chisen: 這一點和這次討論的議題密切相關。
engsen: The point is highly relevant to this discussion .

eng: the state of depending on or trusting in something or someone
chisen: 這一地區依賴旅遊業謀發展是不明智的。
engsen: The region's reliance on tourism is unwise .

eng: the state of depending on or trusting in something or someone
chisen: 你過於信賴她的想法和專業知識了。
engsen: You place too much reliance on her ideas and expertise .

eng: to like or enjoy something
chisen: 我一向喜歡迎接挑戰。
engsen: I always relish a challenge .

eng: to like or enjoy something
chisen: 我不想告訴她她兒子被捕的消息。
engsen: I don't relish telling her that her son has been arrested .

eng: the part of something that is left after the other parts have gone, been used, or been taken away
chisen: 我吃了一大半，剩下的餵狗了。
engsen: I ate most of it and gave the remainder to the dog .

eng: the part of something that is left after the other parts have gone, been used, or been taken away
chisen: 旅行中第一天下了雨，不過其餘的日子天氣都很好。
engsen: It rained the first day but the remainder of the trip was fine .

eng: in mathematics, the amount that is left when one number cannot be exactly divided by another
chisen: 九除以四商二餘一。
engsen: 9 divided by 4 is 2 , remainder 1 .

eng: the act of forcing someone to leave an important position or job
chisen: 一直有要求總統下臺的呼聲。
engsen: There have been calls for the president's removal .

chi: （尤指藝術、文學或音樂的）復興
eng: a new growth of activity or interest in something, especially art, literature, or music
chisen: 歌劇正在復興，這是人們期待已久的好事。
engsen: Opera is enjoying a long-awaited renaissance .

chi: 使成為；使變得；使處於某種狀態
eng: to cause someone or something to be in a particular state
chisen: 他的粗暴無禮讓我無言以對。
engsen: His rudeness rendered me speechless .

chi: 使成為；使變得；使處於某種狀態
eng: to cause someone or something to be in a particular state
chisen: 新技術發展太快，我的舊電腦已經過時了。
engsen: New technology has rendered my old computer obsolete .

eng: to give something such as a service, a personal opinion or expression, or a performance of a song or poem, etc. to people
chisen: 歌手們熱情洋溢地演唱了這首歌。
engsen: The singers rendered the song with enthusiasm .

eng: to give something such as a service, a personal opinion or expression, or a performance of a song or poem, etc. to people
chisen: 我們看到鐵路貨運公司在提供優質服務的同時也贏得了豐厚的利潤。
engsen: We see that freight railroads make good profits while rendering excellent service .

eng: famous for something
chisen: 該地區因其秀美壯麗的自然風光而享有盛譽。
engsen: The region is renowned for its outstanding natural beauty .

eng: famous for something
chisen: 馬可‧孛羅是著名的探險家。
engsen: Marco Polo is a renowned explorer/is renowned as an explorer .

chi: 出租，租賃，租借；租金，租費
eng: an arrangement to rent something, or the amount of money that you pay to rent something
chisen: 這裡房租很貴。
engsen: Property rental is quite expensive here .

chi: 出租，租賃，租借；租金，租費
eng: an arrangement to rent something, or the amount of money that you pay to rent something
chisen: 今年影碟的租金下降了。
engsen: DVD rentals have decreased this year .

chi: 出租，租賃，租借；租金，租費
eng: an arrangement to rent something, or the amount of money that you pay to rent something
chisen: 汽車租賃公司
engsen: a car rental company

chi: 壓抑，壓制，克制（尤指感情）
eng: to not allow something, especially feelings, to be expressed
chisen: 他突然想哭，但他控制住了自己。
engsen: He repressed a sudden desire to cry .

eng: the fact that two people or things look like each other or are similar in some other way
chisen: 所有兄弟都長得很像，一眼就看得出是一家人。
engsen: There was a clear family resemblance between all the brothers .

eng: the fact that two people or things look like each other or are similar in some other way
chisen: 這些價格和我在報紙上看到的大相徑庭。
engsen: These prices bear no resemblance to (= are completely different from) the ones I saw printed in the newspaper .

chi: （尤指對變化和新思想）抵制的，阻止的，抗拒的
eng: not wanting to accept something, especially changes or new ideas

engsen: He accidentally sat on her hat and squashed it .

eng: to push yourself, a person, or thing into a small space
chisen: 房間裡擠得滿滿的，再也擠不進一個人了。
engsen: The room was so full you couldn't squash another person in .

eng: to push yourself, a person, or thing into a small space
chisen: 要是你們再擠擠，我們車裡就能多坐一個人。
engsen: If you all squashed up (= moved closer together) , we could fit an extra person in the car .

eng: to push yourself, a person, or thing into a small space
chisen: 他想趁他母親不注意，把他那條破洞牛仔褲塞進衣箱裡。
engsen: He tried to squash his ripped jeans into the suitcase while his mother wasn't looking .

eng: to stop something from continuing to exist or happen, by forceful action
chisen: 管理階層很快就消除了有關公司可能會被接管的謠言。
engsen: Rumours of a possible takeover of the company were soon squashed by the management .

eng: a situation in which something is not likely to move or change
chisen: 政治穩定時期
engsen: a period of political stability

eng: If something stabilizes, it becomes fixed or stops changing.
chisen: 他兩天前心臟病再次發作，不過現在病情已經穩定了。
engsen: He suffered a second heart attack two days ago but his condition has now stabilized .

chi: （植物的）莖，稈；（葉或果實的）柄，蒂；（花）梗
eng: the main stem of a plant, or the narrow stem that joins leaves, flowers, or fruit to the main stem of a plant
chisen: 她修剪了一下鬱金香的花梗，然後把它們插進了花瓶。
engsen: She trimmed the stalks of the tulips before putting them in a vase .

eng: to speak or say something with unusual pauses or repeated sounds, either because of speech problems or because of fear and anxiety
chisen: 「我們甚……甚麽時候能……能走？」她結結巴巴地說道。
engsen: "Wh-when can we g-go?" she stammered .

eng: to speak or say something with unusual pauses or repeated sounds, either because of speech problems or because of fear and anxiety
chisen: 他撥了999，結結巴巴地報出了自己的名字和地址。
engsen: He dialled 999 and stammered (out) his name and address .

chi: 主要產品；某物的主要部分
eng: a main product or part of something
chisen: 物資短缺意味著連麵包之類的主食都難覓蹤影。
engsen: Shortages mean that even staples (= basic foods) like bread are difficult to find .

chi: 主要產品；某物的主要部分
eng: a main product or part of something
chisen: 磷酸鹽多年來一直是這一地區的主要産品。
engsen: Phosphate has been a staple of this area for many years .

chi: 主要產品；某物的主要部分
eng: a main product or part of something
chisen: 言情小說和工具書是很多公共圖書館的主要藏書。
engsen: Romantic fiction and reference books are a staple of many public libraries .

eng: a white substance that exists in large amounts in potatoes and particular grains such as rice
chisen: 玉米澱粉在燉煮的菜餚中當作增稠劑。
engsen: Corn starch is used as a thickener in stews .

eng: the state of having no food for a long period, often causing death
chisen: 若不啟動大型緊急援助專案計劃，兩千萬人將有餓死的危險。
engsen: 20 million people face starvation unless a vast emergency aid programme is launched .

eng: the state of having no food for a long period, often causing death
chisen: 這些動物餓死了。
engsen: The animals had died of starvation .

eng: the state of having no food for a long period, often causing death
chisen: 他們付的工錢極少，不夠維持基本生活。
engsen: They pay starvation wages (= not enough money to live on) .

eng: not moving, or not changing
chisen: 停著的汽車／火車
engsen: a stationary car/train

eng: not moving, or not changing
chisen: 車流移動得越來越慢，最後完全不動了。
engsen: The traffic got slower and slower until it was stationary .

eng: not moving, or not changing
chisen: 通貨膨脹率已經幾個月保持不變。
engsen: The rate of inflation has been stationary for several months .

eng: the good reputation a person or organization has, based on their behaviour and ability
chisen: 才高德劭的藝術家
engsen: an artist of great stature

eng: the good reputation a person or organization has, based on their behaviour and ability
chisen: 他作為藝術評論家，享有非常高的聲譽。
engsen: His stature as an art critic was tremendous .

eng: the good reputation a person or organization has, based on their behaviour and ability
chisen: 如果學校能繼續提高聲譽，將會吸引到必要的資金補助。
engsen: If the school continues to gain in stature , it will attract the necessary financial support .

eng: (especially of people) height
chisen: 他紅頭髮，五短身材，很容易認出來。
engsen: His red hair and short stature made him easy to recognize .

eng: a container with holes in the bottom that is put over boiling water in order to cook food in steam, or a machine that cooks food with steam
chisen: 米飯蒸鍋
engsen: a rice steamer

eng: a container with holes in the bottom that is put over boiling water in order to cook food in steam, or a machine that cooks food with steam
chisen: 蔬菜蒸籠
engsen: a vegetable steamer

eng: to encourage something to grow, develop, or become active
chisen: 政府計劃減稅以刺激經濟發展。
engsen: The government plans to cut taxes in order to stimulate the economy .

eng: an action or thing that causes someone or something to become more active or enthusiastic, or to develop or operate
chisen: 她在家裡照顧孩子的時候，覺得被剝奪了活躍大腦的機會。
engsen: While she was at home looking after her children , she felt deprived of intellectual stimulation .

eng: an action or thing that causes someone or something to become more active or enthusiastic, or to develop or operate
chisen: 電的刺激有助於斷骨癒合。
engsen: Electric stimulation can help to heal fractured bones .

chi: 刺激（物），激勵（物）；促進因素
eng: something that causes growth or activity
chisen: 外國投資促進該產業的發展。
engsen: Foreign investment has been a stimulus to the industry .

chi: 刺激（物），激勵（物）；促進因素
eng: something that causes growth or activity
chisen: 這本書將會對這重要領域的研究起促進作用。
engsen: The book will provide a stimulus to research in this very important area .

eng: a supply of something for use or sale
chisen: 現在冬天剛剛過半，但食物的儲備已經不足。
engsen: It is now halfway through winter and food stocks are already low .

eng: a supply of something for use or sale
chisen: 本地商店備有大量明信片和旅遊指南。
engsen: The local shop has a good stock of postcards and guidebooks .

eng: a supply of something for use or sale
chisen: 城市中許多房子都有100多年歷史了。
engsen: Much of the city's housing stock (= the number of houses in the city) is over 100 years old .

eng: the amount of money that a company has through selling shares to people
chisen: 他們擁有公司20%股份。
engsen: They own 20 percent of the company's stock .

eng: the degree to which a person or organization is popular and respected
chisen: 目前，首相的聲望很高／低。
engsen: At present , the prime minister's stock is high/low .

chi: （人的）祖先，血統，家族，世系；（動物的）種，原種
eng: the family or group that a person or animal comes from
chisen: 他是個愛爾蘭血統的美國人。
engsen: He's an American of Irish stock .

chi: （人的）祖先，血統，家族，世系；（動物的）種，原種
eng: the family or group that a person or animal comes from
chisen: 她的祖先是農民／貴族。
engsen: She's of peasant/noble stock .

chi: （人的）祖先，血統，家族，世系；（動物的）種，原種
eng: the family or group that a person or animal comes from
chisen: 一些牲畜將留作種畜。
engsen: Some of the animals will be kept as breeding stock .

eng: to kill someone by pressing their throat so that they cannot breathe
chisen: 她被人用她自己的圍巾勒死，棄屍於樹林裡。
engsen: She had been strangled with her own scarf and her body dumped in the woods .

chi: 有助於計劃成功的；戰略（性）的
eng: helping to achieve a plan, for example in business or politics
chisen: 戰略性撤退／推進
engsen: a strategic withdrawal/advance

chi: 有助於計劃成功的；戰略（性）的
eng: helping to achieve a plan, for example in business or politics
chisen: 他們總是把炸彈安放在戰略要地，務求最大程度地製造混亂。
engsen: Their bombs are always placed in strategic positions to cause as much chaos as possible .

eng: an exciting action, usually in a film, that is dangerous or appears dangerous and usually needs to be done by someone skilled
chisen: 這是部典型的動作片，有很多精彩好看的特技。
engsen: It's a typical action movie with plenty of spectacular stunts .

eng: an exciting action, usually in a film, that is dangerous or appears dangerous and usually needs to be done by someone skilled
chisen: 湯姆‧克魯斯不顧專業人員的警告，在《不可能的任務 2》中親自表演自己角色的特技動作。
engsen: Tom Cruise has performed his own stunts for Mission Impossible 2 , defying warnings from professionals .

chi: 意在引人注目的花招，噱頭
eng: something that is done to get attention for the person or people responsible for it
chisen: 廣告噱頭
engsen: an advertising stunt

chi: 意在引人注目的花招，噱頭
eng: something that is done to get attention for the person or people responsible for it
chisen: 他們的婚姻不過是低級宣傳噱頭。
engsen: Their marriage was just a cheap publicity stunt .

eng: influenced by or based on personal beliefs or feelings, rather than based on facts
chisen: 我覺得我丈夫是世界上最帥的男人，當然我也意識到我的判斷很主觀。
engsen: I think my husband is the most handsome man in the world , but I realize my judgment is rather subjective .

eng: influenced by or based on personal beliefs or feelings, rather than based on facts
chisen: 公司內部決定升職人選時，需要藉助更具體、更客觀的標準。
engsen: More specific and less subjective criteria should be used in selecting people for promotion within the company .

eng: having a lower or less important position
chisen: 配角
engsen: a subordinate role

eng: having a lower or less important position
chisen: 個人需求從屬於集體需求。
engsen: The individual's needs are subordinate to those of the group .

chi: 訂閱，訂購（產品）；（為某項服務）定期付費；定期捐助
eng: to pay money to an organization in order to receive a product, use a service regularly, or support the organization
chisen: 有230萬人訂購了這個線上音樂服務。
engsen: 2.3 million people subscribe to this online music service .

chi: 訂閱，訂購（產品）；（為某項服務）定期付費；定期捐助
eng: to pay money to an organization in order to receive a product, use a service regularly, or support the organization
chisen: 她訂閱了幾本女性雜誌。
engsen: She subscribes to several women's magazines .

chi: 訂閱，訂購（產品）；（為某項服務）定期付費；定期捐助
eng: to pay money to an organization in order to receive a product, use a service regularly, or support the organization
chisen: 我每個月向這個慈善團體捐助十歐元。
engsen: I subscribe €10 a month to the charity .

eng: an amount of money that you pay regularly to receive a product or service

engsen: I decided to take out (= pay for) a subscription to a gardening magazine .

eng: an amount of money that you pay regularly to receive a product or service

engsen: Your business can be listed on the website for a low monthly subscription .

eng: an opportunity to buy shares in a company
chisen: 你很快就有機會認購公司股票。
engsen: You will soon have the opportunity to purchase stock through a subscription offering .

eng: happening after something else
chisen: 書中講述了他患病及隨後隱退政壇的事。
engsen: The book discusses his illness and subsequent resignation from politics .

eng: happening after something else
chisen: 那些爆炸一定是在我們離開後發生的，因為我們甚麼也沒聽到。
engsen: Those explosions must have been subsequent to our departure , because we didn't hear anything .

eng: the use of one person or thing instead of another
chisen: 教練似乎要換人。
engsen: It looks as though the coach is going to make a substitution (= change one player for another in the game) .

chi: 隱約的；暗淡的；不易察覺的，不明顯的；微妙的
eng: not loud, bright, noticeable, or obvious in any way
chisen: 房間被刷成了淡粉色。
engsen: The room was painted a subtle shade of pink .

chi: 隱約的；暗淡的；不易察覺的，不明顯的；微妙的
eng: not loud, bright, noticeable, or obvious in any way
chisen: 這部戲的內涵過於隱晦，小孩子可能難以理解。
engsen: The play's message is perhaps too subtle to be understood by young children .

eng: relating to a suburb
chisen: 他們住在華盛頓近郊。
engsen: They live in suburban Washington .

eng: a number of similar events or people that happen, exist, etc. after each other
chisen: 過去的一年裡，一連串的醜聞和接連爆出的內幕損害了政府的威望。
engsen: A succession of scandals and revelations has undermined the government over the past year .

eng: a number of similar events or people that happen, exist, etc. after each other
chisen: 生活只不過是一連串沒完沒了的聚會和晚宴。
engsen: Life was just an endless succession of parties and dinners .

eng: happening one after the other without any break
chisen: 那是球隊接連第四次失利。
engsen: It was the team's fourth successive defeat .

eng: happening one after the other without any break
chisen: 他連續第三次贏得世界錦標賽冠軍。
engsen: He won the World Championship for the third successive year .

chi: 繼任者，接替者；繼承人；接替的事物
eng: someone or something that comes after another person or thing
chisen: 大學在尋找一位繼任者，接替將於今年復活節退休的校長。
engsen: The university is seeking a successor to its vice chancellor , who retires this spring .

chi: 繼任者，接替者；繼承人；接替的事物
eng: someone or something that comes after another person or thing

engsen: This range of computers is very fast , but their successors will be even faster .

eng: to (cause someone to) die because of not having enough oxygen
chisen: 報告說那些受害者是被煙熏死的。
engsen: The report said that the victims had suffocated in the fumes .

eng: to (cause someone to) die because of not having enough oxygen
chisen: 她用枕頭壓在他的頭上，把他悶死。
engsen: She suffocated him by holding a pillow over his head .

eng: a set of connected rooms, especially in a hotel
chisen: 這位歌手在飯店套房裡接受採訪。
engsen: The singer was interviewed in his hotel suite .

eng: a set of connected rooms, especially in a hotel
chisen: 他們在34層有一整套辦公室。
engsen: They have a whole suite of offices on the 34th floor .

eng: a set of furniture for one room, of matching design and colour
chisen: 我為客廳訂購了一套三件的新傢俱。
engsen: I've ordered a new three-piece suite for the living-room .

eng: a set of furniture for one room, of matching design and colour
chisen: 週末我們要請人在浴室／臥室安裝一套新傢俱。
engsen: We're having a new bathroom/bedroom suite fitted at the weekend .

eng: of excellent quality; very great
chisen: 他是一個傑出的舞蹈家。
engsen: He is a superb dancer .

eng: of excellent quality; very great
chisen: 泰勒在上半場要結束的時候攻入了一個極為精彩的進球。
engsen: Taylor scored a superb goal at the end of the first half .

eng: the fact that one person or thing is better, stronger, etc. than another
chisen: 澳大利亞隊很快在對手面前顯示出優勢。
engsen: The Australian team soon demonstrated their superiority over the opposition .

eng: faster than the speed of sound
chisen: 超音速戰鬥機
engsen: a supersonic fighter plane

chi: 基於迷信的；相信迷信的
eng: based on or believing in superstitions
chisen: 有些人迷信地認為把鹽撒在桌上不吉利。
engsen: Some people are superstitious about spilling salt on the table .

eng: the act of watching a person or activity and making certain that everything is done correctly, safely, etc.
chisen: 學生們只有在老師的指導下才能動這些化學物品。
engsen: Students are not allowed to handle these chemicals unless they are under the supervision of a teacher .

eng: something that is added to something else in order to improve it or complete it; something extra
chisen: 醫生說她應該服用維生素補充劑。
engsen: The doctor said she should be taking vitamin supplements .

eng: something that is added to something else in order to improve it or complete it; something extra
chisen: 我晚上教課所賺的錢可以補充我的主要收入。
engsen: The money I get from teaching eveningnight classes provides a supplement to my main income .

eng: something that is added to something else in order to improve it or complete it; something extra
chisen: 我們多付了一些錢，這樣我們在船上就可以有一個單獨的小艙住。
engsen: We paid a supplement (= an extra amount of money) so that we could have a cabin on board the ship .

eng: to do or be better than
chisen: 他以0.01秒的優勢打破了100米短跑的前世界紀錄。
engsen: His time for the 100 metres surpassed the previous world record by one hundredth of a second .

eng: to do or be better than
chisen: 這本書獲得出乎所有人意料的成功。
engsen: The book's success has surpassed everyone's expectations .

eng: to do or be better than
chisen: 這位導演憑藉這部新電影實現了真正的自我超越。
engsen: The director has really surpassed himself (= done better than he has done before) with this new film .

eng: (an amount that is) more than is needed
chisen: 世界上目前生產的食品大大過剩。
engsen: The world is now producing large food surpluses .

eng: (an amount that is) more than is needed
chisen: 我們今年不太可能有任何盈餘。
engsen: We are unlikely to produce any surplus this year .

eng: (an amount that is) more than is needed
chisen: 政府已經授權軍隊出售多餘的武器。
engsen: The government has authorized the army to sell its surplus weapons .

eng: the feeling of excitement or nervousness that you have when you are waiting for something to happen and are uncertain about what it is going to be
chisen: 她讓他焦慮地等了好幾天，才告訴他願意嫁給他。
engsen: She kept him in suspense for several days before she said that she would marry him .

eng: the feeling of excitement or nervousness that you have when you are waiting for something to happen and are uncertain about what it is going to be
chisen: 真是急死我了。
engsen: The suspense is killing me (= I am extremely eager to know what is going to happen) .

eng: the feeling of excitement or nervousness that you have when you are waiting for something to happen and are uncertain about what it is going to be
chisen: 這部電影自始自終一步步加深懸念，最後的結局非常出人意料。
engsen: There is a gradual build-up of suspense throughout the film , until it comes to an unexpected ending .

eng: the act of stopping something happening, operating, etc. for a period of time
chisen: 停戰協定於週一早上六點生效。
engsen: The suspension of fighting is to take effect at 6 a.m . on Monday .

eng: the act of stopping something happening, operating, etc. for a period of time
chisen: 有報導指出這種藥物有危險的副作用後，人們呼籲立即停止使用該藥。
engsen: There have been calls for the drug's immediate suspension , following reports that it has dangerous side effects .

eng: a liquid in which small pieces of solid are contained, but not dissolved
chisen: 懸浮在玉米油中的精製玉米粉
engsen: a suspension of fine cornflour in corn oil

eng: to give something and be given something else instead
chisen: 我們看完各自的書之後，交換一下，好嗎?
engsen: When you've finished reading your book , and I've finished mine , can we swap ?

eng: to give something and be given something else instead
chisen: 我們與度假時認識的人交換了地址。
engsen: We swapped addresses with the people we met on holiday .

eng: to give something and be given something else instead
chisen: 他找到一份銀行的工作後，就不得不脫下牛仔褲和T恤衫，改穿西裝了。
engsen: When he got a job in a bank , he had to swap his jeans and T-shirt for a suit (= he had to wear formal clothes instead of informal ones) .

eng: representing something else
chisen: 圖片底部的骷髏象徵死亡。
engsen: The skull at the bottom of the picture is symbolic of death .

eng: to represent something
chisen: 奧林匹克聖火的點燃象徵著世界各國人民的和平與友誼。
engsen: The lighting of the Olympic torch symbolizes peace and friendship among the nations of the world .

eng: the quality of having parts that match each other, especially in a way that is attractive, or similarity of shape or contents

engsen: The design of the house had a pleasing symmetry , its oblong shape being picked up in its elongated windows .

eng: any feeling of illness or physical or mental change that is caused by a particular disease
chisen: 他抱怨所有常見的感冒癥狀——高燒、頭痛等，都出現在他身上。
engsen: He's complaining of all the usual flu symptoms - a high temperature , headache , and so on .

eng: any feeling of illness or physical or mental change that is caused by a particular disease
chisen: 他 HIV 病毒檢測呈陽性反應已有六年了，但直到最近才開始出現愛滋病的徵狀。
engsen: He's been HIV-positive for six years , but just recently he's started to develop the symptoms of AIDS .

eng: a word or phrase that has the same or nearly the same meaning as another word or phrase in the same language
chisen: small 和 little 是同義詞。
engsen: The words "small" and "little" are synonyms .

chi: （處事、言談等的）得體，乖巧，機敏；外交手腕
eng: the ability to say or do the right thing without making anyone unhappy or angry
chisen: 他從來不懂甚麼處事技巧，大家都不喜歡他那生硬的態度。
engsen: He's never had much tact and people don't like his blunt manner .

eng: a planned way of doing something
chisen: 這些炸彈襲擊事件表明恐怖分子改變了策略。
engsen: These bomb attacks represent a change of tactics by the terrorists .

eng: boring
chisen: 單調乏味的工作
engsen: a tedious job

eng: boring
chisen: 問題是我覺得大多數形式的鍛煉都很乏味。
engsen: The problem is I find most forms of exercise so tedious .

eng: the part of your character that affects your moods and the way you behave
chisen: 暴躁的性情
engsen: a fiery temperament

eng: to (cause something to) end or stop

eng: showing a careful use of money, especially by avoiding waste

eng: calm and peaceful and without noise, violence, worry, etc.

engsen: The hotel is in a tranquil rural setting .

eng: calm and peaceful and without noise, violence, worry, etc.

engsen: A spasm of pain crossed his normally tranquil features .

eng: an occasion when someone buys or sells something, or when money is exchanged or the activity of buying or selling something

eng: an occasion when someone buys or sells something, or when money is exchanged or the activity of buying or selling something

engsen: Each transaction at the foreign exchange counter seems to take forever .

engsen: We need to monitor the transaction of smaller deals .

engsen: Local people have mixed feelings about the planned transformation of their town into a regional capital .

engsen: I'd never seen Jose in a tuxedo before - it was quite a transformation .

engsen: It is possible to make an insurance claim for any goods lost or damaged in transit .

engsen: The question is whether road transit is cheaper than rail .

engsen: There will be an interim government to oversee the transition to democracy .

engsen: In 1606 Guy Fawkes was executed for treason .

chi: 取得巨大成功的；歡欣鼓舞的；洋洋得意的

chi: 取得巨大成功的；歡欣鼓舞的；洋洋得意的

engsen: He's an excellent rider , but he's never won a major trophy .

engsen: We've got to spend the weekend together , so we might as well call (= have) a truce .

chi: 講和（協議）；休戰，停戰（協定）

engsen: Following last month's riots , two of the city's biggest gangs have finally declared a truce , ending years of bloodshed .

eng: a state of confusion, uncertainty, or disorder

engsen: The whole region is in turmoil .

eng: a state of confusion, uncertainty, or disorder

engsen: The country is in a state of political turmoil .

eng: a state of confusion, uncertainty, or disorder

engsen: The Stock Exchange is in turmoil following a huge wave of selling .

eng: the period just before it becomes completely dark in the evening

eng: the final part of a period

engsen: This , the president promised us , was a war against tyranny .

chisen: 口腔／胃潰瘍
engsen: a mouth/stomach ulcer

chi: 極端的；最重要的；最初（或終）的；最好（差）的
eng: most extreme or important because either the original or final, or the best or worst

engsen: Of course the ultimate responsibility for the present conflict without doubt lies with the aggressor .

chi: 極端的；最重要的；最初（或終）的；最好（差）的
eng: most extreme or important because either the original or final, or the best or worst

engsen: My manager will make the ultimate decision about who to employ .

chi: 極端的；最重要的；最初（或終）的；最好（差）的
eng: most extreme or important because either the original or final, or the best or worst
chisen: 通姦是最可恥的背叛。
engsen: Infidelity is the ultimate betrayal .

chi: （團體）意見一致的；（決定或裁決）一致通過的，獲得全體支援的
eng: If a group of people are unanimous, they all agree about one particular matter or vote the same way, and if a decision or judgment is unanimous, it is formed or supported by everyone in a group.
chisen: 陪審團經過短時間商討後一致裁決有罪。
engsen: The jury returned a unanimous verdict of guilty after a short deliberation .

chi: （團體）意見一致的；（決定或裁決）一致通過的，獲得全體支援的
eng: If a group of people are unanimous, they all agree about one particular matter or vote the same way, and if a decision or judgment is unanimous, it is formed or supported by everyone in a group.
chisen: 經過長時間討論，我們對這一提案作出了一致決定。
engsen: After a lengthy discussion we reached a unanimous decision on the proposal .

chi: （團體）意見一致的；（決定或裁決）一致通過的，獲得全體支援的
eng: If a group of people are unanimous, they all agree about one particular matter or vote the same way, and if a decision or judgment is unanimous, it is formed or supported by everyone in a group.
chisen: 新的形式獲得了一致支持。
engsen: The new format has unanimous support .

chi: 揭露，發現（秘密或隱藏物）；揭開（覆蓋物）
eng: to discover something secret or hidden or remove something covering something else
chisen: 調查發現了大規模非法交易野生鳥類的證據。
engsen: The investigation uncovered evidence of a large-scale illegal trade in wild birds .

chi: 揭露，發現（秘密或隱藏物）；揭開（覆蓋物）
eng: to discover something secret or hidden or remove something covering something else
chisen: 該傳記試圖揭示他內心世界的隱秘。
engsen: The biography is an attempt to uncover the inner man .

eng: to fail to guess or understand the real cost, size, difficulty, etc. of something
chisen: 起初建築商向我報價2000歐元，但現在他們說當初估價過低，至少要3000歐元。
engsen: Originally the contractor gave me a price of €2,000 , but now they say they underestimated and it's going to be at least €3,000 .

eng: to fail to guess or understand the real cost, size, difficulty, etc. of something
chisen: 要讓雙方坐下來談判，難度不可小覷。
engsen: Don't underestimate the difficulties of getting both parties to the conference table .

chi: 低估，輕視（尤指競爭對手）
eng: to fail to understand how strong, skilful, intelligent, or determined someone, especially a competitor, is
chisen: 永遠不要低估你的對手！
engsen: Never underestimate your opponent !

chi: 經歷，經受（令人不快的事或變化）
eng: to experience something that is unpleasant or something that involves a change
chisen: 圖版正經歷著一場復興。
engsen: Playing board games is undergoing a revival in popularity .

chi: （常指逐漸地）削弱信心、權威等，損害
eng: to make someone less confident, less powerful, or less likely to succeed, or to make something weaker, often gradually
chisen: 總統指責有兩位內閣部長在暗中算計他。
engsen: The president has accused two cabinet members of working secretly to undermine his position/him .

chi: （常指逐漸地）削弱信心、權威等，損害
eng: to make someone less confident, less powerful, or less likely to succeed, or to make something weaker, often gradually
chisen: 批評只是削弱了他們的信心。
engsen: Criticism just undermines their confidence .

chi: （開始）做，承擔，從事（尤指耗時或困難之事）
eng: to do or begin to do something, especially something that will take a long time or be difficult
chisen: 要求學生們做些簡單的實驗。
engsen: Students are required to undertake simple experiments .

eng: to unfasten something that is fastened or tied
chisen: 有人能幫我解開安全帶嗎？
engsen: Can someone help me to undo my seat belt ?

eng: to remove the good or bad effects of an action or several actions
